boardgame.name: Broken Tales
boardgame.description:
Once upon a time, a child saved the world of fairytales. His reward was a wish. The One who Plots in the Shadows saw an opportunity to tarnish the child's heart, whispering to him a corrupted idea. The child asked the King of Fairytales that the Villains, accursed for centuries, be granted a new life. This was to be their chance for redemption. This was how the Villains became good. But any light needs a shadow, and in turn, the Heroes became evil. At that moment, all fairytales were shattered.

Broken Tales is a tabletop RPG of dark stories, reinterpreting fairytales from an upside-down perspective. Players will become part of the Order, a secret group operating on behalf of the Papacy to investigate supernatural events beyond human comprehension. Moving through an 18th century Europe imbued with mysticism and horror, the main characters of Broken Tales are nothing less than the former antagonists of fairytales, thrown into a new world resulting from the wish of the Child Savior.

[from the Publisher's website]

boardgame.name: Marvel: Crisis Protocol – Card Pack 2022
boardgame.description:
Some of Marvel: Crisis Protocol’s favorite fighters are back and ready to re-enter the fray with this Marvel: Crisis Protocol - Card Pack 2022! Featuring 24 updated stat cards for some of the game’s earliest heroes and villains, Marvel: Crisis Protocol - Card Pack 2022 refreshes some of the game’s most iconic characters.

In addition to the updated characters, this pack adds updated versions of 74 essential Team Tactic cards and copies of all six Infinity Gems to players’ collections, giving them everything they need to power up their teams and claim victory!

-description from publisher's website

boardgame.name: Enquêtes à Los Angeles: Nouveaux Crimes
boardgame.description:
After discovering the game and the 5 first cases as a detective or as the Chisel in "Enquêtes à Los Angeles" (the French version of Detective: City of Angels), you can know continue the experience with the 4 next cases.

WARNING: You will need the core game to play with "Nouveaux Crimes" as the box will only contain the 4 new cases and the corresponding booklets.

Even if the different cases will be slightly harder one after the other, the game stays the same: a 3 to 9 players asymmetrical investigation game.

The detectives will have to solve the case before their opponents. The Chisel will try to manage the story and how it's told, sometimes helping a detective in distress, sometimes slowing a lucky detective down, choosing the answers of the interrogated witnesses.

Every game, dive deep into the nice film noir atmosphere of Los Angeles during the 40s.

-description from publisher
boardgame.boardgamefamily: Game: Detective – City of Angels (Van Ryder Games)

boardgame.name: Disney Sorcerer's Arena: Epic Alliances – Turning the Tide Expansion
boardgame.description:
Take your combat skills in Disney Sorcerer’s Arena: Epic Alliances to all-new levels with the Turning the Tide expansion pack!

Davy Jones, Moana, and Stitch bring new attacks and abilities true to their characters that will change the course of the Arena’s already epic battles. Disney Sorcerer’s Arena: Epic Alliances is the ultimate PvP tabletop game for Disney and Pixar fans and gamers where players can build teams out of Disney and Pixar heroes and villains and compete in an expandable, learn-as-you-go battle arena game.

In Disney Sorcerer's Arena: Epic Alliances, you'll Recruit from a battle-ready roster of Disney and Pixar heroes and villains then combine the cards for your characters into a single deck.

You take turns playing standard actions and cards from your hand to move your characters and attack opponents. If you knock out rival characters or occupy certain spaces near the center of the arena until your next turn, you score points.

When a player reaches 20 points or runs out of cards in their deck, the game ends at the conclusion of that round, and whoever has the most points wins.

-description from publisher
boardgame.boardgameexpansion: Disney Sorcerer's Arena: Epic Alliances Core Set

boardgame.name: FLOE
boardgame.description:
Floe will take you on a heroic journey across the Iceberg Sea. Choose your path and leave your mark on the realm. What type of hero will you be?

Will you…

Explore the ever-changing iceberg islands and discover long-lost secrets?
Sail the windy waves in search of sunken treasure and daring adventure?
Fight fearsome monsters on your journey into the frozen heart of the ice?

Or you can kick back and enjoy some kelp noodle soup—the choice is yours! In Floe, there are many ways to be a hero.

Gameplay

On each turn, you take actions by drawing tiles from a shared bag—or by returning previously drawn tiles to the bag. These actions allow you to activate your hero, sail your boat, add new regions to the map, and draw cards into your hand.

Floe features a unique region-to-region movement system that allows heroes and sailboats to navigate the realm with ease: only the natural shapes of the ice and seas are used to determine movement—so you’ll never be counting squares on a grid.

You can build an engine by leveling up your character, upgrading your signature weapon, constructing new buildings, and acquiring powerful magic items. The first player to place all their Floe sigils by completing heroic challenges is the winner.

-description from publisher

result.value: Some necessary text - easily memorized or small crib sheet
Moderate in-game text - needs crib sheet or paste ups
Extensive use of text - massive conversion needed to be playable

boardgame.name: QE: Alternative Artwork Bid Checks
boardgame.description: Limited Ian O'Toole illustrated bid checks that were introduced as Kickstarter promos alongside the launch of QE: Commodities.

boardgame.name: Valentine
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Villains Abound details super-powered villains for your Savage Worlds game. This release presents Valentine, a former government assassin who lost his love to an alien attack. Now he uses his nanite suit to hunt down anything that isn't human and kill it, be they hero, villain, or simply trying to go about their lives in peace.

The Valentine nanite suit can grow long, deadly claws, can leap great distances and move at high speeds, and is capable of withstanding significant damage. It also enhances the wearer's natural abilities. It is ideal for hunting aliens and other threats.

boardgame.name: Spell Codex Volume 1
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

The Collected Knowledge of a Hundred Spellcasters

Bringing together all the spells from nearly two dozen companion sources, the Book of Magic: Spell Codex Volume 1 has something for everyone. These spells have been updated for clarity and expanded to cover classes introduced after their original publication. Gathered together for the first time, these spells will give your character the edge you’ve been looking for.

Within these 96 pages, the Book of Magic: Spell Codex Volume 1 contains:

Over 170 spells for all 26 spellcasting classes. From wizard to bloodrager, cleric to paladin, psychic to medium, you'll find spells for your character here.
New short descriptions, making it easy for you to discover and find that perfect spell.
Artwork to make this feel like a true spellcaster’s tome.

boardgame.name: É Top!? Geek & Pop
boardgame.description:
In É Top!? each round a new Top 10 category is revealed and players must guess something from the list. You don't win the game just knowing the answers, because you can earn points by contesting the guesses that you consider wrong. Just be careful, because if you contest a correct guess, you are the one who will lose...

This new version of É Top!? features cards with themes from the geek universe and pop culture and can be played alone or combined with other versions of the game.

boardgame.name: É Top!? Natureza
boardgame.description:
In É Top!? each round a new Top 10 category is revealed and players must guess something from the list. You don't win the game just knowing the answers, because you can earn points by contesting the guesses that you consider wrong. Just be careful, because if you contest a correct guess, you are the one who will lose...

This new version of É Top!? features cards with themes from the animal, mineral and plant kingdoms and can be played alone or combined with other versions of the game.

boardgame.name: Sopalavras
boardgame.description:
Remember when your mother scolded you for playing with your food? Well, now she'll want to play too! Sopalavras is a game based on the famous alphabet soup: the more you move the noodles, the bigger the word you will form.

Six letter tiles are opened at the start of the round. Players try to use the revealed letters to mentally form words with at least three letters. The letters of the words already formed on the table can be used to create new words with the letter tiles of the round. When a player forms a word, he must say aloud the NUMBER of letters that word has. From there all players can keep trying to form words for as long as 1 minute. During this time, whenever a player is able to mentally form a word with an equal or greater number of letters than previously spoken, he must say that number aloud. The player who assembled the highest word wins 1 point or 2 points if he uses all 6 letter pieces in the round. The game ends when a player scores 5 points, winning the game.

boardgame.name: Joke King
boardgame.description:
Joke King is a hilarious create your own comic strip family card game for kids and adults!

In this Kingdom, laughter is the law, and the funniest player wins the Crown! Joke King was created by the team that bought you the award-winning family game, Kids Against Maturity. Here, you make funny comic strips of the KAM FAM by playing illustrated comic-book style card combinations. Joke King is simple to play and has multiple play styles and difficulties. The object is to create the funniest card combinations and show your friends that you are The Joke King!

- How To Play -
Deal everyone 10 cards.

Choose someone to wear The Crown.

One card is flipped from the deck face up.

The Crown plays one card from their hand before or after the flipped card.

Then the other player chooses one card from their hand to finish the comic strip.

The Crown reads all cards out loud and chooses their favorite

That player wins the round, and the first player to win 5 rounds is crowned The Joke King!

boardgame.name: Swords & Shaman of Sonnegard: Beasts & Lore Volume I
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Introducing the Swords & Shaman of Sonnegard Beasts & Lore Volume I.
This publication includes additional information and creature statistics for use with S&SoS and 5e systems.

This pdf includes:
New Goddess - Lama
Improved Stat Block format
New and Updated (existing) Creatures with S&SoS and 5e stat blocks
Laiteph - Dark Elf Slavers
Dark Hound
Goblins & Orcs
Grue
Lamassu
Cave Spiders
Werewolf

boardgame.name: Trapmaster
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Give Your Traps Real Teeth (and Spikes, and Deadfalls . . .)

Whether you are a novice DM hunting for inspiration, or a veteran gamemaster working to round out the deepest level of your dungeon, Trapmaster has what you’re looking for (if you make that Perception check, of course). From spike-lined pits to knockout gas, every kind of trap is represented, complete with diagrams for clarity.

This 30-page booklet includes:

26 fully fleshed-out traps, both magical and mundane
A complete description of each, including triggers, effects, and countermeasures
Suitability for a range of character levels
Detailed diagrams illustrating form and function
Traps that go beyond the dungeon, including everyday objects and locations
Advice and suggestions for creating your own traps

Become a Trapmaster and keep your players on their toes!

boardgame.name: Iconic Adventuring System Fundamentals
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Welcome to a new addition to the tabletop role-playing genre. Although a role-playing game, the Iconic Adventuring System is vastly different than its predecessors. First, apart from being a role-playing game, it involves deck building, where players create a character deck as they adventure. The character deck serves as their potential to overcome hazards and monsters to advance the storyline forward. Secondly, unlike traditional role-playing games, the Iconic System does not use dice for resolution.
...
Fundamentals is an abridged version of the forthcoming role-playing rules found in the Iconic Adventuring System. While the basic and core rules are comprehensive, this guide offers a general insight into the system and what to expect.

boardgame.name: Bitte nicht öffnen: Bissig!
boardgame.description: In the co-operative dice game Bitte nicht öffnen – Bissig!, you need to protect Icy the yeti from Dr. Spargel and her nasty yeti catcher.

boardgame.name: Yak: Birdwatch
boardgame.description:
This mini-expansion adds an extra action card that will offer you more to think when selecting which action to play. Plus, yak are not the only animals in the game anymore, their friends the birds have joined and will offer you a new way to score. Those birds are easily scared away, so choose well where you place them on your stone tower. And don’t forget, an opponent can also attract these birds to his own tower! This mini-expansion add eight colorful birds, a bag, 4 birds action cards and 16 feathers tokens.This item is a webshop exclusive and it is a must-have, these birds are simply too cute.

- description from the publisher's website

boardgame.name: Scoop
boardgame.description:
Scoop is a series of fast-paced word games where players compete to make three-letter words.

The game has 35 target cards, 2.25" x 2.25", with single letters, and 150 cards, 1.15" x 1.15", with bigrams (two letters); all cards have point values. There are rules for 4 different games. In all but one of them the bigrams are all face up on the table for all to scoop from.

1. Be Quick: Reveal a target card, and everyone has 15 seconds to gather as many bigrams as they can that make a word with that card.

2. Elimination: Reveal a target card, and each player chooses one of their 10 bigrams to make a word with it. The one with the highest-scoring word gets the points of all the cards revealed.

3. Winner Takes All: Each player chooses one of their 3 letter cards and takes a bigram to go with it. The one with the highest-scoring word gets the points of all revealed cards.

4. Scoop Five: Each player takes five bigrams, one for each of their five letter cards. Each player scores the points for each of their words made.

boardgame.name: The Astral Tides RPG: Core Rules
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

It's Space Opera meets the Golden Age of Piracy in this swashbuckling, high-flying, alien hunting roleplaying game! Create your starsailor, gather your crew, and craft your ship. Then, your Game Master will lead you on a journey through the Han'Arai Galaxy, and all of the adventure, danger, and mystery that comes with it!

The Astral Tides Roleplaying Game is the tabletop RPG adaptation of Nicholas Kory's fiction series of the same name. The game takes players on a wild ride through a science-fantasy galaxy full of colorful alien species, strange magical powers, and all the loot you can carry.

With a strong focus on working together as a team, Astral Tides boasts mechanical benefits for building relationships with your fellow crew, assisting each other in difficult tasks, and even roleplaying with one another! Only by sticking together can any of you hope to make it out in the wide open void.

The Astral Tides RPG: Core Rules is set to provide Game Masters and players with everything they need to assemble their crew, craft their ship, and set sail for adventure in the stars of the Han’Arai Galaxy. The Core Rules features eight chapters, outlined as follows:

Chapter One: The Basics covers the basic structure of the game, general terminology, and when and how dice are used.

Chapter Two: The Crew is the largest chapter of the book. This chapter details the specific game elements that go into creating your very own crew member, from 6 different species to 11 different aspects to creating your own background and choosing a hallmark.

Chapter Three: The Loot describes how weapons, gear, datapads, kits, and other important equipment are handled in this RPG system.

Chapter Four: The Ship allows the crew to select one of three ship models, and then customize it’s attributes and features to create the vessel they will use to sail the Han’Arai Galaxy.

Chapter Five: The Game delves deeper into the details of the game rules that were introduced in Chapter One. Hazards, Challenges, Vehicular Combat, Companions, Settlements, and more are outlined here.

Chapter Six: The Galaxy covers the major historical events of the Han’Arai Galaxy, from the discovery of Superspace to the Nuani War.

Chapter Seven: The Life runs you through the basics of life in the Han’Arai Galaxy - ranks and roles on a starship, currency, technology, armaments, transportation, and more.

Chapter Eight: The Master helps guide game masters on preparing and running their games of The Astral Tides RPG, as well as giving GMs charts and tables to help them create new worlds, non-player characters, and ships.

Chapter Nine: The Tools provides over 50 creatures, a handful of villains, a dozen ships, and all the rules and building blocks you need as a GM to create your own monsters that are perfectly balanced for your crew of player characters.

In addition to the core book, you'll also get 20 Virtual Tabletop Tokens, Ship Deck Plans for three different models of vessel, a printable character sheet and a printable ship sheet. With this one purchase, you've got everything you need to gather your crew and start sailing the wide open black!

boardgame.name: The Oracle of Aegis Isle
boardgame.description:
"Wine shall be spilt, backs shall be broken, a daughter of Aegis Isle shall rise, and ever shall these days of festivity and sport be known as the Oracle Games. But this once-in-a-lifetime event is not for the salt-browed denizens of the island alone, and all with heart are welcome.

The Oracle of Aegis Isle is a setting-neutral adventure that encourages social roleplay on a small but lively island. While the characters can have a whole lot of fun just by participating in competitions and otherwise enjoying the festivities of the Oracle Games, a conspiracy unfolds beneath the surface, ancient secrets and strange treasures await discovery, and the monsters guarding them await their next good meal."

(Author Summary)

boardgame.name: LockDown
boardgame.description:
LockDown is a word game where players collect letters to build successively longer words as listed in their secret, anagrammatic manifests. Players may alter others' words, and lock down their own words to prevent alteration. [adapted from the rule book.]

LockDown has 106 letter cards, 6 bonus indicators, and 20 manifest cards, each of which has four lists of four successively longer anagrams, e.g. SEA, EAST, DATES, TASTED, or RUT, ROUT, TROUT, TRYOUT. Each player is dealt 7 letter cards, one manifest, and one bonus indicator.

In a turn a player may do one of these:
- Draw 2 cards.
- Trade a card from the hand with another player.
- Play one or more cards to make words on the table.
- Add a card to another player's word to make a different word.
- Take a card from another player's word.
- Lock one of your words by flipping its letters face down.
- Gather one or more letters from your words, making any words you wish, and placing unused cards back in your hand.
Then they draw or discard so their hand has 7 cards.

The round ends when someone plays an End of Round card, or plays their whole hand out and declares the round over. Then players score positive points for their words that are listed on their manifest, and negative points for their words that are not on their manifest.

boardgame.name: Option
boardgame.description:
This is an elaboration of the idea behind the traditional word game Ghost.

The deck has 61 letter cards: one is dealt to the table as the key letter, and the rest evenly divided among the 2-6 players.

On their turn, a player plays a card so that it adds to either a row or column of letters that include the key letter. The row or column played to must spell part of a valid word, whether read forwards or backwards, without actually finishing a complete word.

A player who finishes a word, or makes an invalid set of letters, or cannot make a valid play, or loses a challenge to a play, gains a point. The round ends and the deck is shuffled for another round. When a player reaches a certain number of points they are out; the last player left wins.

—user summary

boardgame.name: War of Words
boardgame.description:
This game consists of the formation and capture by reformation of words made from letters of different value, the object of the game being to use as many letters of value as possible in such formation and capture. [From the rules sheet.]

There are at least 129 letter cards, which are more like cardboard tiles, 1" x 1". At the start, 12 are dealt to each player, and the rest are face down in the table center. In their turn, each player:
- Draws a letter.
- Either:
--- plays a word from the hand
--- attacks and captures another player's word by adding one or more letters to it from their hand, making a new word which has a different root meaning
--- passes
They draw 2 letters after forming or capturing a word.

The game ends when all the letters are drawn and everyone passes. Points are scored for each letter in all the words a player owns, according to the letters' ranks. Most cards are Privates, worth 2 points, but each vowel has two cards which are officers, worth more:
A - General (20 points)
E - Major (15 points)
I - Captain (10 points)
O - Lieutenant (5 points)
U - Sergeant (3 points)

The player with the highest score wins.

boardgame.name: Lord of the Chords: Who Let The Chords Out? – 1st Booster Pack: Advanced Chords
boardgame.description: Prepare to ask, "What chord is that?" with the Advanced Chords Pack's new game mechanic - Chord Extensions! Play crazy 9ths, 11ths and 13ths to spice up your chords and gain buffs to forte-fy your reign as the Lord of the Chords!
boardgame.boardgameexpansion: Lord of the Chords: The Geekiest, Punniest Music Theory Card Game

boardgame.name: Expedition to Skull Island
boardgame.description:
Expedition to Skull Island is a long-form solitaire print-and-play expedition, where you take the role of captain and try to bring back as much fame and treasure you can from the mystery-shrouded shores of Skull Island.

Outfit a ship, recruit a crew, and set sail!

Randomized encounters will assail you in many different environments: on the trip to the island, on the beaches, in the jungles, on the rivers, in the cliffs surrounding skull rock, in the dark, and inside skull rock itself. With hundreds of "choose your own adventure" style paragraph encounters along with other table-based encounters, there's lots to discover and explore on the island.

Can you make it back to Tortuga alive? Your score at the end is dependent on the goals you set at the beginning – are you looking for treasure, are you looking for adventure, or are you interested in both – and what you discover and bring back from the island.

—description from the designer

boardgame.name: Star Wars: Galactic Hide & Seek Action Board Game
boardgame.description:
"A Galactic Hide & Seek Race is underway! Obi-Won Kenobi, Anakin Skywalker, Yoda and Ahsoka Tano must find the Jedi Force tokens and be the first to race back home!

Players take the role of one of four Jedi: Obi-Won, Anakin, Yoda or Ahsoka. They take turns rolling the dice moving around the board to get to concealed Jedi tokens. When a player find all four of their character specific tokens they must race back Home before the other players to claim victory.

boardgame.name: Name The Thing: Retail Hell
boardgame.description:
Welcome to Retail Hell! This expansion to Name The Thing introduces new 99 new cards with all new prompt and word cards from the crazy shopping frenzy that is Retail! Add these cards to your Name The Thing collection and do your best to name even more things!

-description from publisher

boardgame.name: Name The Thing: After Dark
boardgame.description:
When the sun goes down this expansion comes out to play! This expansion to Name The Thing adds 99 adult only cards to your collection. Can you name all the naughty things?

-description from publisher

boardgame.name: Name The Thing: Sports Ball
boardgame.description:
BATTER UP! Step up to the plate with Sports Ball, the expansion to Name The Thing that introduces all sorts of Sports based words and things to name. Can you name all the things in time for the buzzer!?

-description from publisher

boardgame.name: Defenders of the Realm: Revised Board
boardgame.description:
A revised game board for the Defenders of the Realm base game featuring an updated look with new location labels and roads on the map.

Revised game board for the Defenders of the Realm base game which features much cleaner graphic design for clarity and readability.

boardgame.name: Game of Astronomy
boardgame.description:
This contains thirty-eight card, each bearing the chart of a constellation and a point value from 5 to 25, and the rule book which contains a brief story “Legends of the Zodiac”, and a set of sentences, one for each constellation card. [Adapted from the rule book.]

The cards are dealt equally to all players, except the leader who will read “Legends of the Zodiac” as rapidly as possible. When they read the name of a constellation they count to 5 rapidly. If the player holding that card calls out its name before 5 they keep it in their holdings on the table; if not, they place it in front of the player to their left. After the end of the story, players add up the points of the cards they won, and the player with the most gets a 25 point bonus. Reshuffle the deck and repeat this, rotating the leader, until someone reaches 300 points and wins, or after an agreed-on number of rounds is played, the highest score winning.

An alternate mode has the leader reading from the individual sentences of the constellations, in a randomly chosen order so players won’t know which constellation comes next.

—user summary

boardgame.name: A game about Cute Comical Creatures and trying to identify them after someone makes noises.
boardgame.description:
This is a 'reimagining' of AGAWWCATTITASMN. The new, cuter creatures massively affect the sorts of noises you will be making.

Five cute comical creatures are shown in a central display. One player (the noise-maker) randomly chooses a target creature.

Everyone else closes their eyes whilst the noise-makes makes noises.

After opening their eyes and having time to consider, everyone votes which creature they think may have been the target creature.

Anyone in the majority gets a point, whether right or wrong. It was a sensible guess, as determined by your peers!

Now the target creature is revealed. If the majority was correct, the noise-maker gets a point. It was a good noise!

If the majority was NOT correct, then any player who made a correct guess also gets a point.

Replace the creatures. Repeat.

After everyone has had a chance to make a noise, the game is over. Most points wins.

-description from designer
boardgame.boardgameimplementation: A game about WEE WHIMSICAL CREATURES and trying to identify them after someone makes noises.

boardgame.name: The Melox Football Game
boardgame.description:
This is a promotional game by W.G. Clarke for their Melox Dog Foods in the 1930's. Unusually packaged in a (then) brown grocery bag.

The first player to throw a six kicks off. He then throws again and moves the counter in the direction of his opponents goal, as indicated by the dice. Should the counter fall on a line bearing one of his own players, he continues to throw except where otherwise marked, namely, if the ball lands on a line marked “Foul,” which is a blue player, the Red gets the next throw. If the ball lands on a player marked “ Hands,” then the Blue gets the next throw, and if the ball lands on either player marked “ Free Kick ” then the same side gets a further throw. If the counter finishes on a line bearing an opponent, the throw passes to the other player.

The method of scoring goals is for the counter to fall exactly on Line 12, but if it should fall on or go past Line 13, a goal kick is awarded, the counter being placed on Line 11, on the spots indicated. The centre line is a neutral line, and if the counter falls upon this line, the player continues to throw. The player whose team scores the most goals in 30 minutes (or in the period of time arranged) is the winner.

boardgame.name: Hero's Journey: Original
boardgame.description:
Hero's Journey is a fully cooperative, card-based, adventure game with rogue-like elements to be enjoyed solo or with up to 5 of your closest friends. Experience adventure with 12 unique Heroes as you navigate through dozens of guided Encounters with dangerous Monsters, intriguing Scenarios, and mesmerizing Locations; all with plenty of Loot and ever-changing Qualities to ultimately face the deadly Boss waiting at the end of the Round. No session is quite the same with dynamic, journey-altering gameplay and creative Quests. There's no time to waste, gather your party and embark on your own Hero's Journey!

The game is played with cards, dice, and tokens in a series of Rounds with a set number of Encounters in each and concluded with a Boss fight. Each player takes a turn as the Revealer, to flip an Encounter card face up to resolve combat with a Monster, make decisions in a Scenario, or feel the effects of a new Location. Play then continues with a new Revealer each Encounter until ultimately facing a Boss at the end of the Round.

Throughout the game, Qualities and Loot will play a huge part in the success or failure of the Party's journey. There are intangible Qualities that provide new active Abilities or passive Positive/Negative Traits with lingering effects. Additionally, there are physical Loot objects with powerful one-time or on-going effects. Players can never be too comfortable with their load-outs as these elements of the game are constantly changing.

This is a new take on the well-loved fantasy RPG genre allowing for solo or group play with up to six players who may all enjoy the experience simultaneously. The self-narrating story provides an opportunity for everyone to be a part without a game master or hours of preparation. The design allows for simple set-up and a low learning curve including jump-in-jump-out play without compromising on the amount of depth the experience provides. With 148 cards in the base deck and character perma-death, you'll never play the same adventure twice thanks to the well-thought out rogue-like mechanics.

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: The Scarecrow of Renithath County
boardgame.description:
Renithath County is haunted by the scarecrow. This foul monster is destroying the enemies of Millicent the necromacer! Adventurers are needed to stop this menace. This adventure is Saga: the Game's first horror offering.

"Scarecrow of Renithath County" contains magic items and spells that are not found in any other module. This campagin is intended for Saga: the Game, however it is easily utilized for any game system and is system agnostic.

- from the publisher's blurb

boardgame.name: Donnerschlag: Escape from Stalingrad
boardgame.description:
Donnerschlag is a two player game which is playable in one sitting. It is more of a game than a simulation and intended to bring a high player interactivity and replayability to the player's table.

The Situation

From December 12 to December 23 in 1942, "Unternehmen Wintergewitter" was in progress. This was the code name for a relief attack by Heeresgruppe Don to free the trapped 6th Army in Stalingrad.

The Axis formations entered with 50,000 men and 250 tanks, while the strength of the Soviet formations was reported to be about three times that. For the enterprise to have any chance of success, the troops in the encirclement had to break out and meet the advancing Axis troops. The breakout had to be precisely coordinated with the advance of the relief troops and was to commence on the cue “Donnerschlag”. The breakout was never ordered and the troops in Stalingrad were never able to be relieved. This sealed their fate.

Players will be recreating this episode, with the Axis side attempting to secretly establish and reach a meeting point, thus effectively freeing the 6th Army, while the Soviet will try to impede such outcome.

The Scale

A hex represents 4 kms (2.5 miles) of terrain from side to side.
Each turn represents a period of 1-2 days.
Combat units are mostly Brigades & Regiments for the Soviets and Romanians, Battalions & Abteilungen for the Germans.

—description from the designer

boardgame.name: Trail of the Apprentice Image Cards
boardgame.description:
On the Trail of Adventure!

The Trail of the Aprentice Image Cards are a handy accessory for the 5-part Trail of the Apprentice adventure saga featuring 44 cards. One side of each displays a creature or character portrait, from adversaries like orc bandits and kobold rogues to hell hounds, hags, elementals, and even Kezzerex the black dragon to an assortment of allies and associates from the inquisitive alchemist Ithamar Ruggles to Revien the Seer, including the seven sample iconic characters from the adventure compilation. In addition, the opposite side of each card shows one of the incredible full-color illustrations from the Trail of the Apprentice Adventure Path, from lizardfolk swamp scouts to orc raiders in The Bandit's Cave to the climactic confrontation with Belazeel himself in The Wizard's Dungeon!

- from the publisher's blurb

boardgame.name: 5th World Magic II PF2E
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Read Magic: 5th World Magic II brings 10 spells from the 5th edition of the well-known tabletop roleplaying system and adapts, tweaks and translates them to work within the Pathfinder Roleplaying Game Second Edition.

boardgame.name: Starfall (5E)
boardgame.description:
Hide Content
Description
From publisher blurb:

It Came from Beyond the Stars!

What begins as a simple rescue mission takes a turn for the surreal when the heroes are abducted by a great silvery egg that whisks them into the stars. Finding themselves aboard a crippled star-faring vessel, long stranded in orbit around the their homeworld, the heroes encounter an enigmatic race of human starfarers, prisoners aboard their own ship by alien foes that threaten their survival even as they menace the heroes' own world. Seeking these alien enemies through tunnels of steel and corridors crackling with energy, the heroes must brave an artificial jungle stocked with fearsome flora and fauna to reach the long-abandoned bowels of the ancient ship, only to come face-to-face with an alien threat of unimaginable horror … an alien threat that has just initiated the ship’s self-destruct sequence!

Starfall is a massive 76-page Pathfinder Roleplaying Game adventure for 13th-level characters that merges sorcery and spacecraft, blending magic and machines with a touch of cosmic horror to create an harrowing journey into danger that is literally out of this world. This adventure can be played on its own or as an accessory to the Metal Gods Adventure Path. Like every product from Legendary Games, it brings together the talents of the top authors and artists in the business to bring you a fantastic play experience at the table and a product that is as pleasurable to read as it is to use. When you combine innovative layout, beautiful aesthetics, and excellence in design that is second to none, that is when you Make Your Game Legendary!

- from the publisher's blurb

boardgame.name: Terror in the Streets: Huguenauts and Other Distractions
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

A supplemental add-on with side-adventures for LotFP's Terror in the Streets.

boardgame.name: Azul: Master Chocolatier
boardgame.description:
In the game Azul, players take turns drafting colored tiles from suppliers to their player board. Later in the round, players score points based on how they've placed their tiles to decorate the palace. Extra points are scored for specific patterns and completing sets; wasted supplies harm the player's score. The player with the most points at the end of the game wins.

Azul: Master Chocolatier includes double-sided factory boards, with these tiles being placed on these boards at the start of each round. One side of the factories is blank, and when using this side the game plays exactly like Azul. The other side of each factory tile has a special effect on it that modifies play in one way or another, putting a twist on the normal game. Additionally, the tiles are modeled to look like chocolates and other treats, despite remaining as inedible as the tiles in the original game.

result.value: Some necessary text - easily memorized or small crib sheet
Moderate in-game text - needs crib sheet or paste ups
Extensive use of text - massive conversion needed to be playable

boardgame.name: Winds of Magic
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

From the shattered warpgates at the poles of the world raw energies of Chaos flow into the world, powering works of sorcery and sustaining Daemonic entities. This is magic in a pure but unstable form. Thanks to the wise counsel of Teclis, greatest of the High Elf Mages, Human wizards have learned to draw upon a single facet to work with a form of sorcery which is relatively safe, but still capable of feats of vast power. These isolated strands of raw magical energy are known as the Winds of Magic.

Winds of Magic is a comprehensive guide to the practices and traditions taught by the eight Colleges of Magic. As well as providing background to the development of magic in the Empire it includes details of a multitude of magic practices, creatures, and places.

Each of the eight lores of magic taught by the colleges is provided with a revised and expanded roster of spells and a separate career for each sort of wizard.
Rules are provided for rituals, complicated spells that can be used to empower magical sites, create magical creatures, or summon powerful but wild entities.
Details on the summoning of Incarnate Elementals, the creation of Magical Constructs and how to develop a familiar as either an NPC or a Player Character.
Details on the properties of magical sites, such as the lines of waystones that drain magic towards the Great Vortex in Ulthuan, and several sites associated with a particular wind.
Characters can tell the future, read the past, or brew magical potions thanks to rules for the practices of Augury, Psychometry and Alchemy (both magical and mundane).
A set of new careers allowing Characters to specialize as a Scryer, Mundane Alchemist, Beadle, or Magister Vigilant.
Eight of the Empire's pre-eminent wizards, from Balthazar Gelt to Elspeth von Draken, are detailed as potential patrons for Characters.


Several nemeses are described, such as the Blue Scribes who seek catalogue every spell in existence for the glory of Tzeentch; Egrimm van Horstmann, the greatest Chaos Sorcerer alive; and Mòna Mimn, who wishes to turn all the Old World into a vast fenland.

boardgame.name: NPCs: Wanted 05
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Your players' characters will run into many people during the course of a gaming session. Some will be wanted by the law or other authorities.

For in-person games, print out these pages and clip out a Wanted poster as a handout. For virtual games, show your players the section of the file for the fugitive you want them aware of.

This system-agnostic collection includes:

An elven poacher
A dragonborn suspected of witnessing a murder
An armed elf seen leaving the royal castle
A male catkin wanted for public drunkenness

boardgame.name: Everyday Heroes Lookbook
boardgame.description:
From Inside Book

And Thus They Were Born.
Everyday Heroes™ is first and foremost a game inspired by action cinema and other thrilling tales of adventure from comics, books, and our own imaginations. As we began to flesh out the classes, these iconic characters started to come to life.

Like the great iconic characters that came before - D&D’s Regdar the Human Fighter or Pathfinder’s Fumbus the Goblin Alchemist - we’re excited to showcase the 18 iconic characters for our rule system.

boardgame.name: Cutthroats and Crew (5E)
boardgame.description:
Keep the Crew Close and the Cutthroats Closer!

Once pirate PCs seize a ship of their own, they need experienced crews! Cutthroats and Crew brings you 10 detailed NPCs to master every part of a ship, all with individual backgrounds that can be linked together. Simple to drop into existing crews as recurring characters or as the masters of the Seagrave's Fang, this crew of scalawags may be friends or foes, raiding alongside the heroes or trying to steal their plunder! These scurvy sailors can also draw the heroes into a running feud with wereshark cutthroats on their trail (including half a dozen more NPCs ranging from untrustworthy to deadly dangerous), demanding that PC pirates honor the Pirate Code and lend a hand against an enemy that threatens every freedom-loving freebooter that ever sailed the Pirate Main and what don't wish to become slaves of the bloody moon! Plus a killer collection of maritime magic items and seagoing spells to enrich any nautical campaign!

Cutthroats and Crew is an open-ended accessory that is a terrific resource for any oceangoing adventure, offering allies and enemies that can enrich an aquatic campaign. It is an excellent resource for any pirate campaign using the 5th Edition rules of the world's most famous roleplaying game! Grab this 32-page character accessory today and Make Your Game Legendary!

- from the publisher's blurb

boardgame.name: The Great British Baking Show Game
boardgame.description:
In The Great British Baking Show Game, players take the role of bakers on the show and race each other to recreate the configuration of baking cards shown on the recipe cards. Players need to choose whether to move quickly at all costs, or whether to take more time to select the best flavors for their bake and avoid the dreaded "soggy" cards.

To capture the sportsmanship demonstrated when bakers step in to assist others, players can use "Help!" cards to select wild cards from the center of the table. A "Bin" token allows players to throw out elements of their bake once per round.

boardgame.name: Unique Items: Collection 12
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Whether found in a shop, as part of a treasure hoard in a dungeon, or simply in a ditch at the side of the road, feel free to add these unique items to your next gaming session. Some are magical, most are mysterious, some are less-than-interesting.

Items include:

Barbarian necklace giving some powers of the giant bear
Armor made from leather, and part of the shell of a dragon turtle
A ring - an ugly, lumpy ring
You find a sword in a ditch at the side of the road. Is it magic?

boardgame.name: Shokgast
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Do you dare to explore the catacomb hives of these ravenous, shocking mutants? Will your dig team rescue doomed captives and unearth the bizarre collections of junk, souvenirs, or priceless relics that these flesh eaters hoard? Find out by grabbing your copy of Monday Mutants 18, Shokgast, today!

These pack hunters get their name from both their dreaded shock tendrils and their ghast-like tendency to feed on both the living and those in fresh graves. Shokgasts inhabit subterranean ruins and cave complexes, and herein, dig out individual sleeping holes to form ‘crypt dens’. Within each of these cavities, a shokgast stashes its prized collection of treasures. These so-called treasures can range from old action figures, sport cards, batteries, body clippings or even priceless relics. So too, many shokgast catacomb lairs contain living victims. These hapless souls are held in makeshift larders for when the hunting outside is poor, or the graveyards of nearby settlements freeze over. Will your character end up in such a pen?

Introducing our 18th Monday Mutant presentation for the Mutant Epoch (TME) Tabletop RPG. At twelve pages long, this offering is way bigger than was expected and is surely the biggest one we’ll ever do. Honest. It includes a 2d20 random collection roll table, along with four mini adventures with isometric view maps showcasing an assortment of sample shokgast crypt dens.

boardgame.name: Vast Kaviya: Adventurer's Handbook
boardgame.description:
This book is a collection of the player-oriented gaming material from the Vast Kaviya campaign setting for 5E. Check out the free primer PDF to see if this book devoted to primordial and savage adventures is right for you!


New Races! Joining classics like boggards, gnolls, and mongrelfolk are the plant-like alai, insectile kanca, parasitic ottunni, and saurian taino-kar. There's also new subraces for aasimar (elated, soul, and vindico) as well as genasi (acid, ash, mist, and mud), dwarves (mistdweorg), and halflings (mistling).



New Class Archetypes! Path of the Psion-Primal barbarians, Lunar clerics, Burning druids, Primal Leader fighters, Pyrokine monks, Oath of Web paladins, Primal Hunter rangers, Savage Poisoner rogues, Animator sorcerers, Dreamer sorcerers, and two new warlock patrons (the Grandmother and Hivemind).



New Classes! The dual-natured agile warrior gemini class appears here with the atavist, equalist, and reluctant hero balances, and it's got a new archetype that revolves around day and night—the nychthemeron. If you've always wanted to tame a simple-minded creature to go on adventures with (be that an aberration, beast, dragon, monstrosity, or ooze of Intelligence 5 or less), look no further than the monster tamer class! There are also four unique 8 level prestige classes: elementalists that ultimately transform into their chosen element, fractured soul shapeshifters with nuanced control over their bodies, magic-eaters that become tougher and more lethal by rejecting all things supernatural, and primal shamans that unlock primitive psionic powers.



New Options! Discover who your Amnesiac background adventurer truly is, gain control over slivers of magic using naturally occurring raw mana, or take a feat to embrace your mistdweorg ancestors or the illumination granted by the underground City of Lost's potent Sun Stone—or set your sights on stealing the legendary gemstone!


- from the publisher's blurb

boardgame.name: Sepulchre of the Wolf King (PF1)
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

A pair of exceedingly large, powerful and ferocious ogres prey on travellers and merchants alike from their crumbling, subterranean home, but have no idea what deathless horrors lurk in the deeper dark below their noisome lair.

Sepulchre of the Wolf King is a short dungeon adventure designed for four to five 5th-level characters. Nominally set in the Duchy of Ashlar to the north of the town of Dunstone, the adventure can be placed in any hilly, wooded area beset by lawlessness and banditry.

boardgame.name: Crypts & Catacombs
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Add depth and flavour to the crypts and catacombs in your campaign.

boardgame.name: Marsh Town
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Add depth and flavour to the marsh towns in your campaign.

boardgame.name: Swamp Dressing
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Add depth and flavour to the swamps in your campaign.

boardgame.name: Urban Oddities
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Add depth and flavour to the cities in your campaign.

boardgame.name: Borderland Town
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Add depth and flavour to the borderland town in your campaign.

boardgame.name: Red Dragon's Lair
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Add depth and flavour to the red dragon lairs in your campaign.

boardgame.name: Woodland Dressing
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Add depth and flavour to the woodlands in your campaign.

boardgame.name: Word Poker
boardgame.description:
Word Poker takes the well-known framework of poker and transforms it into a compulsive family word game. Instead of normal playing cards, it uses letter cards with each letter having its own score value. The aim is to make the highest-scoring word using any combination of the five cards on the table and the five cards you are holding. There are rounds of betting where you can bet on the strength of your word to win the pot of chips. Quick start rules mean that you don't need any knowledge of poker to get playing.

—description from the back of the box (adapted)

The rules are for Texas Hold 'Em poker. All the steps are there: the flop, turn, river, etc. Besides using letters to make words, the only rules difference is that players start with a hand of five cards rather than two.

—user summary

boardgame.name: Ocean Pointcrawl Generator
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

With this pointcrawl generator, explore the sea and head towards the unknown!

This supplement contains:

3 pages to generate biomes types (beach, sea, island), adjacent nodes and links between them,
4 pages to populate the nodes with points of interest (landmarks, settlements, lairs, ruins, and marvels),
2 pages with a detailed example, showing how to use the generator,
1 printable pointcrawl template of 7x10 nodes (A5 format)

boardgame.name: City Pointcrawl Generator
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

This City Pointcrawl Generator allows you to create cities of various sizes, with different types of districts and to locate all the points of interest you may find in it!

This product is in A5 format, has a printable black & white cover page and can easily be printed as a booklet.

It comes with:

-3 tables describing the size, characteristics and appearance of the city,
-2 pages for the generation of districts, links between them, and the number and type of adjacent nodes,
-6 pages to generate points of interest (landmarks, buildings, lairs, ruins and marvels),
-2 pages with a detailed example to show you how to use the generator,
-1 template of 7x10 nodes (A5 format)

boardgame.name: Everyday Heroes Quickstart Guide
boardgame.description:
From Inside Book

This special quickstart edition has been designed to let you
jump into Everyday Heroes and start playing immediately.
Fundamentally, it’s the same game as you will find in the
full Everyday Heroes rule book, just trimmed down. The full
version greatly expands the options for play, and includes
lots of extra materials for building characters and creating
campaigns to play in.

Some small details may change from this Quickstart Edition
to the Everyday Heroes core rules. As this guide is being
written, Everyday Heroes is still in playtest, putting finishing touches on the system, and balancing the classes.

boardgame.name: Book of Feasts Deck
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

A Feast Fit for a King

The smell of roasting meat fills the hall. Gossips whisper. Amours exchange furtive glances. A fight nearly breaks out. But then, with a fanfare of trumpets, the lord and lady enter—the feast is about to begin!

The Book of Feasts and the companion Feast Deck bring a a new format (in the form of a mini-game) that elevates feasts to the same level as tournaments and battles, as befits the biggest social events of the year!

Feasts are important and vital social events in the lives of any knight, on par with tournaments. Like tourneys, the feast is a vehicle for driving interactions, schemes, rivalries, and alliances between Player-knights and Gamemaster characters. With the rules presented in this book and the companion Feast Deck, you can make banquets guaranteed to produce interesting plot twists and lasting memories of social triumphs and failures, no matter the period from Uther to the twilight of Arthur.

boardgame.name: Star Trek Adventures Rules Digest
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

THESE ARE THE VOYAGES OF THE STARSHIP ENTERPRISE,
ITS FIVE-YEAR MISSION, TO EXPLORE STRANGE NEW WORLDS,
SEEK OUT NEW LIFE AND NEW CIVILIZATIONS,
TO BOLDLY GO WHERE NO ONE HAS GONE BEFORE…
Star Trek Adventures takes you to the final frontier of the Galaxy, where new discoveries await the keen explorers of Starfleet. Your duties may take you to the edges of known space, or to Federation colonies in need, to the borders of neighboring galactic powers or into the eye of interstellar phenomena.

The 304-page Star Trek Adventures Rules Digest PDF is a more compact version of the core rulebook and features updated original era layout and art throughout. Previously available only as part of the Tricorder Collector’s Box Set, this handy, digest-sized softcover edition is perfect for landing parties and gaming on the go!

The core rules can be used for any era of play, and gamemasters wishing to use this edition to run missions during different periods will have no trouble using the rules as presented.

Create your own Star Trek stories of discovery and adventure on the final frontier. Complete 2d20 game system featuring all the rules you’ll need to create your crew and run your games.

An extensive exploration of the United Federation of Planets and its galactic neighbors in the Alpha and Beta Quadrants. Guidelines for gamemasters on how to run an adventure of exploration and discovery for the crew of a Federation starship.

A full catalogue of aliens and antagonists including Klingons and Romulans. Brought to you by a team of expert Star Trek writers, including writers from previous editions of Star Trek roleplaying games and other gaming talent.

Personal logs and intercepted communications by Starfleet Intelligence provide a new perspective on Star Trek and its events.

boardgame.name: The Six Paths
boardgame.description:
The Six Paths is a sourcebook on gender among the Heortlings.

Contents include:


Descriptions of the six main Heortling genders
The cults of Heler, Nandan and Vinga
Six example characters exploring the gender identities.


- from the publisher's blurb

boardgame.name: Matricás Laci: Kapj el!
boardgame.description:
Matricás Laci quietly sneaks around. No one’s s looking. Perfect. Time to steal some sweets and cakes. Only that funny haired Sárika wouldnt have eyes everywhere. She always informs the police about Laci’s mischieves.

This is a hidden role bluffing game in which you take the role of either Laci or Sárika. The goal is to collect the most sweets for your team. You play cards secretly then resolve the actions after shuffling. A policeman takes out one Laci. One Laci can carry two sweets. The rest of the sweets go to Sárika’s team. Later you can put in special cards to make the game more exciting.

Based on the Matricás Laci stories by Adrienn Vadadi

boardgame.name: Zesty: The Slow Game
boardgame.description:
You can learn the principles of sustainability by playing with family and friends. Intelligent fun and lots of green-themed challenges.

Zesty is a game to learn how to save the environment… one challenge at a time! The funniest way to challenge yourself to change your habits step by step.

Help the Planet with small actions that can be done in an hour, a day, a weekend or even several days.

You and your team draw a Challenge card. You will have up to 1 week to complete the highest number of actions listed on the card and, thanks to ZESTY, you will be able to change your habits and those of those who will play with you.

You will read, think, play, record your team's progress on a very special log.

The Challenges are divided into five Thematic Areas: Nature, Consumption, Pollution, Society, Emotions and will allow you to reflect on many different topics related to the well-being of the Planet and its inhabitants.

Zesty is a "slow" game: your skills are not demonstrated with speed but with commitment and attention to important topics, which you can explore in a very special book.

Warning: this is a cooperative game. You win, or lose, all together!

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Copan: Dying City
boardgame.description:
Welcome to the city of Copan, shining jewel of the Maya civilization. The city is flourishing, and as one of its ruling families, this golden age holds many opportunities for you to increase your influence and wealth. But Copan is destined to fall. Dark times lie ahead, and as you work to secure your legacy over generations, you have to face the city's slow decline. Your progress will hindered by dwindling resources, crumbling political structure, natural disasters, and war.

Will your family become a part of the history of Copan, forever carved into the steps of the hieroglyphic stair? Or will your story be forgotten?

Copan: Dying City is a heavy Eurogame for 1 to 4 players with both worker-placement and tile-placement mechanisms. The game features a reversed difficulty curve because when play begins, resources are plentiful, making most actions easy to accomplish. However, all resources are finite. When they reach critical levels, they trigger potentially devastating events, and once they run out, they're gone forever. Every move you make impacts the rest of the game, both for you and other players, as Copan's inevitable fate looms.

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: The Mysterious Witch
boardgame.description:
From the publishers blurb:

The Mysterious Witch is an adventure designed for low level players, for use in any fantasy generic-system TTRPG. This adventure is themed around dark magic, mystery and corruption. Exploration and dangers await players as they travel into a forsaken village among the woods, besieged by undead creatures and horrors. The village asks for help to find the culprit, but the actual truth is more complicated, and beneath the dark veil, a sad reality awaits.

boardgame.name: Rebellion: Britannia
boardgame.description:
Rebellion: Britannia is a game about the Roman military campaigns to suppress the Silures, Brigantes, and Boudica Rebellions (47-61 CE) and the relationships between the key British tribes.

In this game, 1-4 players take control of one of the powerful factions of the time: either Rome or one of the key British tribes—the Iceni, Silures, or Brigantes. Over the course of 12 game rounds (lasting 60-90 minutes), players attempt to gain the most victory points by controlling land, burning Roman infrastructure, and reducing enemy forces.

Rebellion: Britannia is a card-driven wargame. Each player’s available actions are largely dictated by the cards they currently have available to them, and, following a simple Sequence of Play, players use these cards to recruit and move pieces on the board, secure control of regions, engage in diplomacy, form alliances, and battle against their rivals.

Rebellion: Britannia is fast to learn—it’s a low complexity asymmetric game with few rules, a simple sequence of play, and a high quotient of strategic choices. The game depicts a dynamic military and political situation in first-century. Britain, distilled into 60-90 minutes of play time.

—description from the publisher

result.value: Some necessary text - easily memorized or small crib sheet
Moderate in-game text - needs crib sheet or paste ups
Extensive use of text - massive conversion needed to be playable

boardgame.name: GreedFall 2
GreedFall II: The Dying World
boardgame.description: GreedFall 2 is an RPG that focuses on story and player choice, but with new gameplay features including more tactical combat. Uprooted from the island of your birth, find your freedom by exploring the old continent and forging your destiny through alliances, scheming, and battle. It's up to you to end one man's ambitions of conquest, which could spell the end for the continent and your island.

boardgame.name: Zheng He
boardgame.description:
Zheng He: Admiral of the Ming Voyages is a solitaire game that recreates the voyages of the Ming treasure fleets in the early 1400s. In the game you take the role of Zheng He, commanding the fleet as it sails the Indian Ocean, earning glory for the emperor, and keeping favor with the ministers of the court so the voyages can continue.

Your goal is to score as many Victory Points as possible before the political will to continue the voyages runs out. Victory Points are earned by visiting ports, gaining envoys, winning battles, and completing special goals. You also earn Minister Points during each voyage by trading and having good relations with ports, which determine whether the game continues with another voyage, and also allow you to upgrade and repair the fleet, and recruit and train officers.

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Dodos Riding Dinos: Dodo Dash
boardgame.description:
A standalone game with more Dodos Riding Dinos characters and tracks that integrates with the original game.

This expansion features a new way to interact with your Dodo as a projectile.

In this racing-dexterity game, players throw projectiles to impede the other players from reaching the finish line first. Flick eggs, throw bananas, drop meteorites and more!

During the scheming phase, all players choose a card from their hand and play it facedown. Aggressive cards (red) are stronger than normal cards (blue) but if too many players choose an Aggressive card, their effects will be cancelled.

In the running phase, players resolve their cards in turn order. Advancing towards the finish line and resolving effects. Reaction cards (green) can be played to react in between turns.

At the end of the round, the player in the lead advances 1 hex while the rest draw 1 card.

Make sure to keep cards in your hand, otherwise you will have to go back. Projectiles is the surest way to damage your opponents or forcing their Racer to go back.

Each board has a unique dynamic that will make the experience very different.

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Viceroy: Solo Variant Die
boardgame.description:
This is a pearlescent red d8 used for the solo variant of Viceroy. It has colored images of the four gems in the game. Each gem is featured on two opposite sides of the die, replacing the need to draw gem tokens blindly from a cup or bag with a roll of this die.

This die was featured as a stretch goal through the 2018 Kickstarter campaign for the Viceroy: Times of Darkness expansion.

boardgame.name: Star Trek Adventures: Discovery Season 3 Player Characters
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Let’s fly!

This 22-page PDF contains player character statistics for the crew of U.S.S. Discovery NCC-1031-A as seen in season 3 of Star Trek: Discovery. The PDF includes Captain Saru, Lieutenant Commander Paul Stamets, Captain Michael Burnham, Cleveland “Book” Booker, Ensign Sylvia Tilly, Ensign Adira Tal, Philippa Georgiou, Lieutenant Commander Hugh Culber, and Commander Jett Reno. It also includes player rules for Kelpiens, statistics for several supporting characters, and game statistics for U.S.S. Discovery-A.

boardgame.name: Midia
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

A new volume of the official Atlas of Mythika for the Mazes & Minotaurs RPG...

Discover the fabled, decadent kingdom of Midia - Mythika's equivalent of Carthage!

This 28-p. gazeteer offers extensive and fascinating background information on the culture, religion, politics and history of Midia (as well as some rules on War Elephants).

(Previously published in the glorious (and now defunt) Minotaur Quarterly webzine, this material has been specially reformatted for the Atlas of Mythika series of supplements).

boardgame.name: The Land of the Sun
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

A new volume of the official Atlas of Mythika for the Mazes & Minotaurs RPG...

Discover the fabled Land of the Sun - Mythika's equivalent of Ancient Persia!

This 28-p. gazeteer offers extensive and fascinating background information on the culture, religion, politics and history of the Akamen Empire, including rules for creating local characters and a couple of new creatures.

(Previously published in the glorious (and now defunt) Minotaur Quarterly webzine, this material has been specially reformatted for the Atlas of Mythika series of supplements).

boardgame.name: The Defense of Sirmia
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

The town of Sirmia is under attack from Gnolls, and the players are trusted to man the defenses...

Recommended Average Party Level (APL): 5
Experience from Completion: ~11,950 XP
General Theme: Tower Defense, Elimination
Setting: Any, Starlight Chronicles
Sessions to Finish: x1 session - x3 hours

boardgame.name: D-Day Dice: Legendary Supporter Resource Card
boardgame.description: This is a player resource card in a green camo scheme (lighter colors in comparison to the later camo "Legendary Resource Card" from the KS pack for D-Day Dice [Second Edition]) rather than a national color, with "Legendary Supporter" printed in white and a green/black "flag" on the back, as it was the final stretch goal included in with the 2011 Kickstarter Campaign.

boardgame.name: D-Day Dice: Dice Pouches
boardgame.description: These five felt-material pouches were included as exclusive items during the 2011 Kickstarter campaign. They come in the blue, green, tan, and brown player/country colors as well as a black bag for the German player when using Atlantik Wall expansion. Each bag has the D-Day Dice Logo printed in white on it, and are large enough to hold the six RWB dice each player uses throughout the game.

boardgame.name: D-Day Dice: Messenger Bag
boardgame.description: The Messenger Bag was included with pledges from the 2011 Kickstarter campaign for D-Day Dice. This is make with an off-white canvas-like material, featuring the game logo printed in black on it, with a shoulder strap and space to hold two copies of the game or one copy plus that Atlantic Wall Expansion.

boardgame.name: Paranormal Investigator's Handbook
World of Darkness: Paranormal Investigator's Handbook
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

You think that because you’ve spent the night in a haunted house, seen a ghost or two, and participated in an exorcism, that makes you a bona fide paranormal investigator? Mere ghost hunting is for amateurs, buddy.

We’re going to teach you how to hunt real, tangible, unrepentantly murderous monsters.

We’re going to show you how to bind and control the spirits of the dead.

We’re going to give you access to a collection of tools and weapons you didn’t know existed.

You want to investigate the paranormal? Now’s your final chance to turn away, before things get scary.

The Paranormal Investigator’s Handbook includes:

A toolkit of weapons and devices for use against all agents of the paranormal.
Merits, Flaws, Numina, and Rituals for you to apply to your characters in the World of Darkness.
A bestiary of monsters, cryptids, and supernatural threats, to add to your World of Darkness games.
A selection of new orders and societies to which your characters might belong, or whom they might oppose.

boardgame.name: D-Day Dice: D-Day Dice Tin Box
boardgame.description: This is a tin tox with the same cover design as the D-Day Dice game box cover amd a very similar storage volume. This was included as part of pledges for the 2011 Kickstarter campaign and could be used to hold all the Kickstarter extras that came with the pledges.

boardgame.name: Fantasy Realms: Deluxe Edition
boardgame.description:
Bruce Glassco’s Fantasy Realms is a modern classic, and this new Deluxe Edition has updated every card with a sleek, intuitive graphic design. The base game cards have also been updated to include new art from Anthony Cournoyer to match his beloved work on The Cursed Hoard expansion, giving the entire game a fresh look!

It includes:


The original base game with all new art and graphic design!
The Cursed Hoard, which includes two expansion modules, also with new graphic design!
The Jester and Phoenix cards, previously only available as promo cards!
100+ art sleeves to protect all the included cards, plus some extras!


In Fantasy Realms, you build your Realm, one card at a time, as you collect Beasts, Armies, Wizards, and more! Each card is unique and scores points based on the other cards in your hand. You start with seven cards, and each turn you’ll draw a new card from the deck or discard, and discard one card from your hand, always trying to improve your Realm! Whoever’s realm scores the most points is the winner!

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Making Words Snap
boardgame.description:
Here is a fab learning device ideal for young minds to learn words and understand phonics. This unique deck of cards lets you play two family favourites, Snap and Pairs, using language concepts. For example, when playing Snap with this fantastic deck of cards, you would be trying to snap cards that create words such as 'br' and 'ain'.

To play Pairs, simply turn all the cards upside down and turn two over to see if they make a word. If they do, then the cards are kept; if not, they are turned back face down.

The aim is to collect all the cards. Two fun games in one that help children learn important language concepts.

Helping children gain a head start at school in an essential skill, Making Words Snap is the smarter way to play Snap and Pairs!

Contents: 52 playing cards [26 word beginnings of 2 letters and 26 ends of 3 letters], 3 rules cards

[The above adapted from the website, archived Sep 2015.]
boardgame.boardgamefamily: Series: Educational Snap and Pairs (Green Board Game Co)

boardgame.name: My First Making Words Snap
boardgame.description:
Master early years language concepts, whilst having lots of fun with this deck, through either Snap or Pairs. For example, playing Snap with this fantastic deck of cards, you are trying to snap sections of words together, such as 'c' and 'at' to form 'cat'.

To play Pairs, simply turn all the cards upside down and turn two over to see if they make a word. If they do, then you keep them; if not, you turn them back face down.

The aim is to collect all the cards. Two fun games in one that help children learn fundamental language concepts.

Helping children gain a head start at school in an essential skill, My First Making Words Snap is the smarter way to play Snap and Pairs!

Contents: 52 playing cards [26 with 1-2 letter word beginnings, 26 with 2-letter endings], 3 rules cards

[The above adapted from website, archived Sep 2015]
boardgame.boardgamefamily: Series: Educational Snap and Pairs (Green Board Game Co)

boardgame.name: Against the Monstrous Horde
boardgame.description:
Against the Monstrous Horde is a dice game of fantasy combat that is played using a variety of polyhedral dice.

Each player manages a set of polyhedral dice that represents a party of adventurers defending a village against an army of monstrous creatures. The players compete to see who can drive away the most enemies before the battle ends by rolling their dice and using them to attack, to heal, and/or to perform special abilities. Defeating enemies earns a player points, and gameplay ends once one player scores 100 or more points. The winner is the player who achieves the highest score.

—description from the designer

boardgame.name: Miao Bau Ciao
boardgame.description:
Three discs representing cat, dog and child are placed on the table.

Then an arrow is turned and you have to be the fastest player to put your hand on the right puck and also say the corresponding word.

So if the arrow points to the dog, you need to say BAU and put your hand on the dog's disc. If the cat comes out you have to say HELLO and put your hand on the cat. Simple isn't it?

What if we told you that there are also bonuses and penances?

—description from the designer

boardgame.name: El Alamein: Heavy Tank Battalion
boardgame.description:
This is a promotional card released for El Alamein along with the Collector's Ammo Box:
- P02 - Heavy Tank Battalion

boardgame.name: El Alamein: Collector's Edition Ammo Box
boardgame.description:
This awesome two shelf Ammo Box will fit both Barbarossa and El Alamein for easy and efficient storage of your battle gear! It is limited to 2,000 copies and includes the Heavy Tank Battalion Promo Card and dividers.

Two shelves inside the box. Trays will be 10″ long to fit the dividers and cards with sleeves.
10″ long of interior space so that you can fit all of the cards inside the box. Box is approximately 10.5″ long, 4″ tall, and 6.25″ wide.
Magnetic closure that holds your cards inside the box.
Dividers for Barbarossa and El Alamein are included inside the box. There is a total of 50 dividers printed with the pile names and images on them (similar to Tanto Cuore).

boardgame.name: War: Game of Thrones
boardgame.description:
War: Game of Thrones is a reimplementation of War(the Brazilian version of Risk), with the theme of Game of Thrones.
The game can be played in two different ways. The first is basically the same as Risk/War, but in the map of Westeros.
The second way keep the basic mechanic of Risk/War, but in order to win, you no longer need to fulfil objective cards. What you need in to place flags of your nation on the map. In order to do so, you need to conquer a territory and spend one army.

—user summary
boardgame.boardgamefamily: Books: A Song of Ice and Fire

boardgame.name: Warband: Wargaming Large Scale Dark Ages or Early Medieval Skirmish Battles
boardgame.description:
This is a set of rules for wargaming large scale Dark Ages or Early Medieval skirmish battles. It can be used with any scale figures (typically 15mm or 28mm).
Each figure on the table represents one man, and the game is designed for battles of around 50 – 100 figures per side.

Basic Concepts:
This game is played on a hex grid. Each hex must be big enough to contain at least 8 singly based foot figures, or four mounted figures.
It is designed to be played with singly based figures.
The game is card driven, so each player has a hand of cards, and cards are played to activate groups of figures and for other events.
There are no units in this game. Figures can move around freely, although they will benefit from the presence of Leaders. Figures are activated for movement, combat and shooting by hex (so some or all of the figures in a hex may move, shoot or fight when activated).
Each army has a Warlord and some Leaders. All rules applying to Leaders also apply to Warlords.

Game mechanisms:
All dice used are normal 6 sided dice. When the rules refer to a particular number that must be rolled, that number or higher must be rolled for success.

result.value: Some necessary text - easily memorized or small crib sheet
Moderate in-game text - needs crib sheet or paste ups
Extensive use of text - massive conversion needed to be playable

boardgame.name: Wurdz
boardgame.description:
The Wurdz deck has 31 letter cards, 21 wild cards, and 4 rules cards.

On their turn, players draw the top card, say a word, and score its points. After going through the deck the highest score wins.

There are two modes:

Alphabet Game: Say a word that has the names of one or more letters of the alphabet in its pronunciation (not its spelling). If it's a letter card, the name of that letter must be part of it. E.g., if it's 'L', the word "elbow" has the names of the letters L and O in its pronunciation, and scores 2 points.

Word Game: Say a word that has other words as part of its pronunciation. If it's a letter card, the word must begin with that letter. E.g., if it's 'C', the word "cargo" contains the pronunciations of the words "car", "are", "go", and "oh", for 4 points.

The Wild cards specify one or more requirements:

Single: The stated word needs only one other word or letter name as part of it.
Multiple: The stated word needs at least two other words or letter names.
Same: The stated word needs at least one other word or letter name stated at least twice. (E.g. "Ohio" says O twice.)


—user summary

boardgame.name: Barbarossa: Playmat – Panzer Regiment
boardgame.description:
Accessorize your deckbuilder or CCG collection with high quality specialty playmats.

This beautiful standard sized playmat, made of a high quality mousepad-like material measures 24.25″ X 14.25″ and features the art of Barbarossa.

boardgame.name: El Alamein: Playmat – Oversized Motorcycle Battalion
boardgame.description:
Accessorize your deckbuilder or CCG collection with high quality specialty playmats.

This beautiful oversized playmat, made of a high quality mousepad-like material measures 36″ X 21″, features the art of El Alamein.

boardgame.name: El Alamein: Playmat – Oversized Map
boardgame.description:
Accessorize your deckbuilder or CCG collection with high quality specialty playmats.

This beautiful oversized playmat, made of a high quality mousepad-like material measures 36″ X 21″, features the art of El Alamein.

boardgame.name: El Alamein: Playmat – Heavy Tank Brigade
boardgame.description:
Accessorize your deckbuilder or CCG collection with high quality specialty playmats.

This beautiful standard sized playmat, made of a high quality mousepad-like material measures 24.25″ X 14.25″ and features the art of El Alamein.

boardgame.name: Barbarossa: Playmat – General Winter
boardgame.description:
Accessorize your deckbuilder or CCG collection with high quality specialty playmats.

This beautiful standard sized playmat, made of a high quality mousepad-like material measures 24.25″ X 14.25″ and features the art of Barbarossa.

boardgame.name: El Alamein: Playmat – Airfield
boardgame.description:
Accessorize your deckbuilder or CCG collection with high quality specialty playmats.

This beautiful standard sized playmat, made of a high quality mousepad-like material measures 24.25″ X 14.25″ and features the art of El Alamein.

boardgame.name: Barbarossa: Playmat – SS Panzer
boardgame.description:
Accessorize your deckbuilder or CCG collection with high quality specialty playmats.

This beautiful standard sized playmat, made of a high quality mousepad-like material measures 24.25″ X 14.25″ and features the art of Barbarossa.

boardgame.name: Evergreen
boardgame.description:
In Evergreen, your goal is to build a lush ecosystem by planting seeds, growing trees, and placing other natural elements on your planet, trying to make it the greenest and most fertile of all.

You choose biome cards from a common pool to determine which area of your planet you'll develop in a round. The cards not chosen make those regions more fertile, and thus more valuable. To create a huge forest, you want to grow trees, plant bushes, and place lakes, while using the power of nature to gain extra actions. Ideally you can concentrate your trees in the most fertile areas, but without them overshadowing one another as you also want them to collect as much light as possible.

boardgame.name: ヤバ百合会の妹たち (Yaba Yuri-kai no Imouto-tachi)
boardgame.description: Take the role of an incoming freshman at a traditional girls school aiming to capture the affection of your seniors by any means—using a variety of tactics from affectionate to wicked.
