Each player has a hand of cards matching their character, numbered 1-15. For 15 rounds, an event card with an affection point value is revealed and each player plays a number facedown. All players reveal their bids at once and the player with the highest number gains that event card. However, some events are worth negative affection and the lowest bidder must take them. If players tie for the highest (or lowest) bid, the next closest player takes the event. If players all have played the same values as another player and no player is able to obtain the event card, it remains in play and is obtained alongside the event card revealed next round, making for higher stakes. Events also have attributes which can give players bonus points at the end of the game if they collect events of the same type. After the 15th round, when players have used all the cards in their hands, the player with the most affection points wins the game.

boardgame.name: F-Life: Dildos & Dolls
boardgame.description: This expansion adds 50 cards including a bunch of relationship cards, Backstories, and more!
boardgame.boardgameexpansion: F-Life: A Card Game About Adulthood

boardgame.name: Pentex Employee Indoctrination Manual
boardgame.description:
POLICIES AND PROCEDURES

The Pentex Employee Indoctrination Handbook is the gold-standard corporate guidebook for employees of the world’s finest multi-national corporation and many of their subsidiary companies. This volume contains the main Pentex handbook, along with the Guide to Werewolves, and this year’s round of updated corporate handbooks for our subsidiaries.

MONKEYWRENCHED!

This is the unredacted version, replete with notes from the higher-ups! It took a lot to get this information out, so it’s had a chance to go through some monkeywrenchers’ hands before going to you. Make good use of it!

The Employee Indoctrination Handbook contains:


A guide to working for Pentex itself, along with the Guide to Werewolves given to certain staff.
Employee handbooks for Endron, Magadon, RED network, Sunburst, and Tellus
Notes on the contents, from both werewolves and the Board of Directors


- from the publisher's blurb

boardgame.name: D20 to Yuma
boardgame.description:
"Drop that wand, Hombre! Reach for the skies!"

D20 to Yuma!

Welcome to a world of cowboys and Indians, hobgoblins, dragons and danger!

"D20 to Yuma" splices the Wild West with elements of the world's favourite fantasy game. Battle with monsters on the wild prairie, face evil land barons and rustlers, or delve into ancient ruins with six-gun in hand.

Play out your favourite western stories and themes in a world filled with mystery and magic.

The game system lets players get straight into the action. A skill system allows players to create all manner of characters to adventure in a world of six guns and sorcery.

So grab your wand, load up the shotgun and join the posse! Adventure just rode west!

- from the publisher's blurb

boardgame.name: Trouble at Mission Wells
boardgame.description:
Load up your six-shooters and ready yer fireballs!

Mission Wells is a complete sandbox campaign setting for the "D20 to Yuma" RPG. Hunt monsters, track down outlaws, and try and keep the peace as range war threatens to shatter this little corner of the New West.

Included in the book are maps for the town of Mission Wells, and the vast territory of "Dragonsnake County" in the Republic of Washington. There are dungeons, lairs, NPC's, new artifacts and treasures. All you need to plunge your players straight into the world of the New West.

See you on the range!

- from the publisher's blurb

boardgame.name: Okanagan Shuffle
boardgame.description:
Okanagan Shuffle is a word card game apparently produced for and sold in the Okanagan Valley of British Columbia. The picture on the back of the cards is of a wind surfer on Lake Okanagan, and the box features a cartoon of Ogopogo, the legendary creature inhabiting that lake.

The game comes with two decks, each with 51 letter cards and 2 wild cards named for Ogopogo. There are rules for five games:

1. A rummy-like game.
Players are dealt 7 cards, and on your turn you may:
- Play a word of 3+ letters from the hand, 4+ if you haven't played a word yet.
- Take a letter out of any played word of 4+ letters, rearranging the remaining letters to make a word, and using the taken letter with letters in your hand to make a new word.
- Replace Ogopogo with the letter it currently stands for and use it to make a new word from your hand.
- Draw a card. You may use it to do any of the plays above.
When one player uses up all cards in hand, the hand ends and each player gets one point per card in hand. After a certain number of hands, the lowest total wins.

2. A children's game reminiscent of Rack-o.
Each player has 5 cards in hand, and on their turn draws from the draw or discard pile, and discards. The first player to have 5 consecutive letters in hand wins.

3. A Gin Rummy-like game with growing hand size.
Deal N cards to each player, who in their turn draws and discards, and lays down their entire hand to spell a word if they can, after which everyone else gets one more turn to try to do the same. Each player who lays down a word gets one point for the hand. The number N of cards dealt (and hence the length of the target word) starts at 2, and increases one per hand until N=8. The highest point total wins.

4. Themed words.
The dealer declares a theme -- e.g. animals, colors, girls' names, etc. -- and deals each player 7 cards. Players draw and discard as in game 3. The game ends when a player can lay down a word of any length that fits the theme declared by the dealer.

5. Solitaire.
Draw 5 cards, and try to make and lay down a word of 3 or more letters. Draw cards as needed. You win if you can use the entire deck making legal words.

boardgame.name: Takumi Zoo
boardgame.description:
Takumi Zoo is a zoo management themed game, created during the designer's summer break of the first grade, and published while they were in the 4th grade. The game won the kid creator award for the STEAM Toy Contest 2021.

In the game, players will be adding terrain tiles to support different animals. Animals added to a zoo increase the zoo's revenues, allowing them to buy other animals. The zoos have a limited number of space, and players will also remove animals from their zoo to make room for new ones.

The game includes some tiles that have special effects, and bonuses that can be earned for certain groupings of animals.

The player with the most points after 12 rounds wins.

boardgame.name: Abomination Vaults
boardgame.description:
User Description

This compiles the 3 volumes of Paizo's Abomination Vaults into one complete volume

boardgame.name: Kabuto Sumo: Andre the Goliath Promo
boardgame.description: Released as part of the 2022 Kickstarter bundle for Kabuto Sumo, this promo adds a new wrestler Andre, and his signature move piece (a peanut).

boardgame.name: Roll or Die
boardgame.description:
You are a band of mighty heroes delving deep into a dungeon rife with treasure and troubles. The skills of the Wizard and the Rogue allow you to navigate the mazes, puzzles and traps with ease. The mighty Fighter decimates the weak goblins and orcs in your path, and the Cleric eliminates the undead with blasts of holy light. But every now and then a more troublesome foe presents itself, and you must work together to defeat the most
dangerous creatures in the dungeon. It is time to Roll... or Die!
In Roll or Die players take turns rolling 5 polyhedral dice (d6,d8,10,d12, and d20)and taking actions to adjust or reroll. After 3 actions the dice are considered "locked" and a result must be filled in on the player sheet, in a series of specific requirements.
After 33 turns all boxes are either filled in or crossed out, and each player will have a final score. The highest scoring player is the winner.

—description from the designer

boardgame.name: BIGFOOT: Roll & Smash – MODS Expansion
boardgame.description:
The action gets bigger and louder with two new trucks and a crew of experts.

MORE MONSTER MAYHEM!
More players at the table = more fun. Expand the player count of BIGFOOT: Roll & Smash to 6 Players AND get two more trucks from TEAM BIGFOOT's history: BIGFOOT #5 and Ms Bigfoot.

GET A CREW
Every driver needs a great crew. With this expansion, you'll get a chance to draft Monster Truck experts to help you plan and execute your run.

MODS Expansion Includes:

5 - 6 Player Rules
CREW expansion - Draft Monster Truck Experts to your team!
*BONUS* - 8 new Obstacle Tiles


Featuring two fan-favorite playable BIGFOOT trucks:

World Record Breaker - BIGFOOT #5
Queen of Crush - Ms. Bigfoot
Player boards and Style decks for each truck


—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Crossing the Line: Aachen 1944 – First Edition Upgrade Kit
boardgame.description:
Upgrade kit for the 2019 edition of Crossing the Line
Includes;
One Mounted Map
One 2nd Edition 44 Page Rulebook
One Solitaire Play Track Mounted Player Aid Card

boardgame.name: Rugpull: A Cure for Degeneracy
boardgame.description:
A rug pull is a degenerate act in the world of cryptocurrency trading where developers scam investors and traders alike by pumping up the price of a coin and later dumping as much as they can for profit before abandoning their project.

Rugpull is a cryptocurrency trading board game that simulates what it feels like to facilitate or be the a victim of a rug pull. Players will compete to out trade and out mine other players to end up with the highest profit. By managing your risk properly or by being risky biscuit, you must take the necessary actions to come out as the most profitable degenerate.

The main object of the game is to attain as much victory points by collecting money tiles throughout the game. Money tiles can be collected by mining and taking away money tiles by selling a coin and performing a rug pulls.

Each player will start with a secret coin as well as 30 money tiles that corresponds to the colour of their wallet(player mat)and take turns in a clockwise direction. Players are to take 3 mandatory actions in order and can chose to take 3 optional actions during their turn:

3 mandatory actions:
1. Draw 1 support card
2. Mine to collect white money tiles and advance mining markers
3. Buy or sell money tiles

3 optional actions
- Rugpull
- Discard to advance mining markers
- Activate support cards

Money tiles that are collected and taken away are placed on the area of the player mat(wallet) where it says "Total Balance". For the end game scoring money tiles are worth different amount of VP depending on their colour. White money tiles are worth 2VP, Money tiles that are the same colour as the wallet is worth 1VP and money tiles that are not white and are not the same colour as the wallet are worth 3VP. The Player with the highest VP wins!

When there is a tie, the player to memorize Proverbs 13:11 ~ "Wealth gained hastily will dwindle,
but whoever gathers little by little will increase it." first will win the game.

boardgame.name: Skytear: Embassy Ruins
boardgame.description:
The battle for Ahasa has reached its apex: as armies breach its sanctums, banners are once more crossed, awakening old rivalries. Where once the glorious Nuptian Embassy ruled, now only a crater dwells, made of crumbled walls and smashed doors. Through its halls covered by debris, Heroes still fight to claim dominion of the Ashen Fortress.

Embassy Ruins is a new and quick-to-play 3-lane battlefield supporting 4 heroes per side. The box contains a neoprene playmat with stitched edges measuring 35x53cm (14x21in).

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Dungeon Hero: Volume One – Starter Set
boardgame.description:
Dungeon Hero is a simple, fast, solitaire RPG game in a print-and-play "zine" format.

Create a hero using eight defining characteristics, like Archer of the Realm or Chainmail or Stealthy. Assign them dice ranging from d12 to d6. Note your Health and Stamina levels, and then select an adventure 'zine.

Each adventure 'zine packs a lot of adventure for such a little size! Using a clever new exploration mechanic, each foray into the dungeon will offer different challenges using a simple combination of two dungeon elements. Select two of your own traits and roll off against the two dungeon elements, and see if you can beat the dangerous situation. If you roll well, you survive to continue deeper. If you fail, you will take damage. But don't despair – you can spend Stamina to re-roll dice before you apply their effects!

If you can make it through the dungeon, you win! Your score is how many treasures you manage to bring out of the dungeon – see if you can beat your high score by playing again!

Volume One of Dungeon Hero contains three eight-page 'zines that you print out, cut, and fold yourself:


Dungeon Hero Core Rules – The core rulebook for playing Dungeon Hero. Explains the rules for character creation and gameplay, and provides an example of play.



Castle Charon – Robed cultists have been seen filing into the ruins of King Charon's castle. Chanting has been heard, and demons have been sighted. Can you set things right?



Fortress of the Frost Giant Jarl – Freezing and starving, you find a Viking outpost, but to stay with them for the winter, you must help them put down the Frost Giant jarl.
boardgame.boardgameexpansion: Dungeon Hero: Volume Three – Bump in the Night
Dungeon Hero: Volume Two – Giant Beasts

boardgame.name: Dungeon Hero: Volume Two – Giant Beasts
boardgame.description:
Already played all the adventures from Dungeon Hero: Volume One – Starter Set? Went straight to Volume Three: Bump in the Night and skipped Volume Two? Well, more adventures await! Print these out, fold 'em up, and get questing!

Dungeon Hero: Volume Two features three new adventures centered around a theme of Giant Beasts:


Web of the Spider Queen – The Queen of Spiders seeks to conquer the sunlit world above. Can you stop her before she rises?



Tower of the Terrapin – The Terrapin Cult hoards the only cure a beloved mentor needs. But can friends made in the City of Scoundrels be trusted to help infiltrate the tower?



The Lost Island – Shipwrecked on an island that was nowhere to be found on the maps, you struggle to survive on an island stuck in time.


Bonus Adventure! Also gain access to the bonus adventure:


The New Hill – A massive mound of dirt and sand appears in a farmer's field. What terrors does it herald?


Note: You will need the core rulebook from the Starter Set (Volume One) of Dungeon Hero to play these adventures.
boardgame.boardgameexpansion: Dungeon Hero: Volume One – Starter Set

boardgame.name: Dungeon Hero: Volume Three – Bump in the Night
boardgame.description:
Already played all the adventures from Dungeon Hero: Volume One – Starter Set and tore through all the challenges in Volume Two: Giant Beasts? Well, maybe it's time you face off against the terrors that dwell in dark places! Print these out, fold 'em up, and get questing!

Dungeon Hero: Volume Three features three new adventures centered around a theme of paying homage to silver screen horror movies:


Full Moon Frenzy – Something is stalking the night under the light of the full moon. Can you stop its rampage?



The Terror of Talonberg – A fortune-teller has read to you her cards, but can her prophecies really help you destroy the evil terrorizing the town?



The Pyramid of Semerkhet – Dehydrated and exhausted, you see the pyramid on the horizon. If not water, at least shade may be found – but what other horrors await you in that awful tomb?


Bonus Adventure! Also gain access to the bonus adventure:


Creature of the Ebon Fen – A group of scholars have hired you to escort them to a lagoon of biological interest, but are the rare fish there worth the risk of entering the unknown jungle?
boardgame.boardgameexpansion: Dungeon Hero: Volume One – Starter Set

boardgame.name: Fable on Your Table: Realm of Goblyns
boardgame.description:
Realm of Goblyns is a new realm for the Fable on Your Table print-and-play miniatures game which adds new enemies and challenges to the base game.

The threat of the goblyns has always been near; the creatures live in the nearby wilderness, but they typically kept to themselves. But something sinister is driving them into the civilized lands, arming them, training them, coordinating their attacks, and stoking hatred. What was once an uneasy truce has devolved into bloodshed. The mothers of Bandi look to you, hero, to do what is necessary to avert this imminent threat.

Realm of Goblyns includes:

Several new base enemy types: Goblyn warriors, Goblyn archers, Goblyn shamans, Hobgoblyns, evil presences, and assassins.

New large enemies: Goblyn archer towers and the terrifying Apex Goblyn.
Some new scenery to spice up your table play.

The companion web app has been updated to generate dungeons and quests with these creatures.

Download the PDF, print it (we recommend on card stock), assemble the miniatures, and get ready to delve into the dungeon!

—description from the designer

boardgame.name: La Cigale et la Fourmi
boardgame.description:
The game theme refers to a tale by La Fontaine: The grasshopper and the ant.
Each player starts with his ant tile in one corner of the board designed as a 9 by 9 grid. On your turn, place one tile of your hand on the board to extend your route and advance your ant on it. Alternatively, with a grasshopper tile, you can block the route of an opponent. By paying a grain of wheat, you can deblock your route. By landing on a space with a grain of wheat, you collect it. The player with the most grains wins.

—user summary

boardgame.name: Outbreak on Hypatia
boardgame.description:
Science officers brought back a strange alien fungus from a survey mission to an asteroid. Following the usual protocols, the fungus was placed in quarantine, but its explosive growth when exposed to the warmth of the ship caused it to break out of its containment area, shattering the glass and releasing spores into the ventilation shafts.

Now, the alien fungus, dubbed the "Phage" by the ship's scientists, is infecting the crew, turning them into lurching, zombie-like horrors that are taking over the ship! The central power grid has failed, and half the crew are either infected or still in cryosleep.

As captain, it's your job to make the life-and-death decisions. You need to get as many crew members off the ship as possible, but you cannot allow the Phage to escape. You'll have to wake the remaining crew members from cryosleep, power up the lifeboat hangar, keep the oxygen flowing, and initiate the self-destruct sequence. Consult your science officers to gain insights into how the Phage works. Send your engineers to jury-rig mechanisms to keep the Phage at bay. Task your operations personnel with keeping the oxygen flowing and the power online. Order your security officers to cover the retreat of your crew. How many can you save from humanity's first encounter with the Phage?

In this strategic solitaire game, you play cards that represent your crew members to different areas of the ship. The game also plays "Phage" cards representing the ever-advancing influence of the alien fungus to the same areas. Using a simple trick-taking mechanic, you quickly determine whether the humans successfully achieve their goals (such as powering up the Bio Lab or restoring the oxygen supply by repairing the oxygen scrubbers), or whether the Phage have killed off the humans attempting to do so.

Each "station" on the ship provides different winning and losing effects, and managing these effects in the face of the onslaught of the Phage is the key to rescuing crew members from the ship. You win by activating the self-destruct sequence and destroying all of the Phage. You lose if the Phage escapes the ship. Your score at the end of the game is how many of your crew members escape.

boardgame.name: Blaster Bolts (#12 - Edge of Collapse)
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

This super-sized 12th issue of Blaster Bolts has a new mini-setting for White Star: Reign of Dicordia: War of the Desert World by RPG designer Darrin Drader.

Edge of the Collapse- New short fiction from Darrin Drader set in the Reign of Discordia setting
Reign of Discordia - War of the Desert World Mini-Setting - includes new playable races and the short adventure The Defiant Ones

boardgame.name: The Frontiers of Space II
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

This is an expanded version of the Frontiers of Space. The Frontiers of Space was released in 2018 for use with Cepheus Engine. It is a sector on the very fringes of human exploration. It represents the absolute farthest that humans have explored in the universe. The Frontiers presents a sandbox for the game master to use in whatever way they wish. It is a wide open sector with many competing interests.

This version includes a much deeper discussion of the governmental entitities and their ongoing efforts to dominate on trade, military and political fronts. It also expands discussion of each system in the sector and on the many spatial anomalies that might be encountered in the Sonora sector of space.

boardgame.name: Departed and Forsaken
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Forsaken souls, stuck in limbo. This is the Pond of Memories and whoever steps into this realm of forgetfulness, might never find a way out...

Recommended Average Party Level (APL): Roleplaying Focused
Experience from Completion: ~ XP
General Theme: Investigation, Roleplaying, Mystery
Setting: Any, Starlight Chronicles
Sessions to Finish: x1 session - x3 hours

boardgame.name: Tiny Epic Vikings: Ragnarok
boardgame.description:
In Tiny Epic Vikings: Ragnarok, you will have to sharpen your axes and your skill as you explore new islands and experience firsthand the battle of the Giants (Jötunn) vs. the Gods and the cunning of the Valkyries. The Ragnarok expansion introduces Giants that will control the islands and weaken the god's fury. It also introduces Valkyries and Giant Slayers that will join forces with your Vikings to combat the Giants! Also included are 6 new gods to further expand the strategies and variability of Tiny Epic Vikings!

-description from Kickstarter campaign

boardgame.name: No Soldier Left Behind: Battle of the Bulge
boardgame.description: No Soldier Left Behind is a cooperative wargame which puts each player into the shoes of a single American soldier. By choosing what to focus on – firing on the enemy, being stealthy, or even summoning your courage by looking at a photo of the girl back home - you test your mettle against the forces of the German army. Can you complete your mission, and bring back all your buddies in the process?
boardgame.boardgamefamily: History: World War II (Battle of the Bulge)

result.value: Some necessary text - easily memorized or small crib sheet
Moderate in-game text - needs crib sheet or paste ups
Extensive use of text - massive conversion needed to be playable

boardgame.name: Household Quickstart Guide
boardgame.description:
From Preface:

Readers beware
These pages are the only two in this book written by a human like you, written by me. Because this book was written by the Little Folk for the Little Folk.
Let me explain.

One day as I was minding my own business, I stumbled upon a tiny little book, so small it could sit on my finger. Obviously I pocketed it. Nobody gives you anything for free these days, on the rare occasions you find something like this, you just have to keep it.
As it turns out, the book had been written who knows when by a fellow named Herasmo J. Hemingway, and he wasn’t exactly a human being, but a “little being”, specifically a “boggart”. If you aren’t following, it’s okay. I too understood nothing of these things before reading the tiny book. Even more so because the book was written in some strange language that was a little old English, a little modern English, and a little chestnut cake.

Herasmo and the other “littlings” are just a couple of “minimeters” tall, a unit of measure that still eludes us, and they live in a huge, abandoned House.
Scratch that, it’s a normal House, they are the ones to be tiny, but they don’t really know this, so they say the House is big. Anyway, this Herasmo was a pretty smart fellow, as he wrote this book to give everyone a chance to relive and retell the adventures lived by littlings in the House, so that their deeds could enter the annals.

This means that what you are holding isn’t just a game, but a bridge between our world and another, much smaller and much more wonderful. Thanks to the book I translated for you, we can finally learn and transcribe the story of the Household and the Little Folks that live there. And this is great.
But even more importantly, we can do this while playing a game together, becoming the protagonists of little great adventures, becoming tiny littlings.
And that’s even better.

Oh, I almost forgot: the book you’re holding now is called Household.

boardgame.name: Welcome Aboard, Captain: Charon Wormhole
boardgame.description:
Learn to play Welcome Aboard, Captain with this exciting adventure that leads you through all the core mechanics of the game.

Welcome Aboard Captain is a solitaire print-and-play tabletop roleplaying game where you play a starship captain, gather a crew, outfit a ship, and head into the galaxy to complete missions.

Charon Wormhole is a special document designed to teach you how to play by introducing the rules step by step as you go through an adventure.

To play, you will need:


This document, accessible in a reader. Do not print it – it's a hyperlinked "choose your own adventure" style document intended to be played on your device.



Paper and pencil. (Index cards recommended.)



At least one set of polyhedral dice: d4, d6, d8, d10, d12. Four sets recommended, but not necessary.

boardgame.name: Welcome Aboard, Captain
boardgame.description:
Welcome Aboard, Captain is a solitaire science-fiction tabletop roleplaying game.

In this game, you will take the role of a starship captain, recruit a crew of bridge officers (science, engineering, etc.), outfit your ship, and head out into the galaxy to go on missions.

boardgame.name: Tablero di Berona
boardgame.description:
Tablero di Berona is a quick-playing dice game for two players, with all the look and feel of a classic pub game.

Players take turns rolling two dice. With each die, they may either place a new chip on that location in their home row, or move a stack from their home row if they already have a stack in that space. Movement is similar to games like backgammon, mancala, Veritas, or Tak: a stack of chips is dropped one piece at a time, covering other stacks as it goes.

When either player runs out of chips, the other player gets just one more turn, and then the winner is the player who captures the most points in the center.

-description from publisher's website

boardgame.name: Delver Second Edition
boardgame.description:
The world is starting to forget, and its memories are pooling into the dungeon. The dungeon is ever-present and you can always find an entrance if you know where to look.

All manner of strange things, unknown histories, and storied artifacts have trickled in, as well as the people who seek to recover them.

Some want their past, some want power, some want truth, and some want redemption. All of them want to survive and get out, but the dungeon resists.

Delver is a surrealist game of dungeon crawling and meaning-making. You will need: 2-5 players, some six sided dice, and something to write with (paper and pencil, an online writing tool - whatever works).

boardgame.name: Delver
boardgame.description:
The world is starting to forget, and its memories are pooling into the dungeon. The dungeon is ever-present and you can always find an entrance if you know where to look.

All manner of strange things, unknown histories, and storied artifacts have trickled in, as well as the people who seek to recover them.

Some want their past, some want power, some want truth, and some want redemption. All of them want to survive and get out, but the dungeon resists.

Delver is a surrealist game of dungeon crawling and meaning-making. You will need: 1 - 4 friends, some six sided dice, and something to write with (paper and pencil, an online writing tool - whatever works).

boardgame.name: Power Core: Call of Cthulhu
boardgame.description:
Lurking behind the thin vale of sanity, ancient beings of imaginable power lurk, forever ready to bring the world to its knees. These godlike beings from beyond time and space can warp the mind, break the will, and obliterate the body. Now, as they stand against each other, the world will be plunged into a maelstrom of horror and madness. Will your hand guide the victors - or will your eternal legacy be wiped out by a being more cunning, more ruthless, and more malevolent than you?

Welcome to a world of unspeakable horror inspired by the works of Howard Phillips Lovecraft, and the Call of Cthulhu roleplaying game, where beings older than time itself manifest on Earth and fight each other, as they prepare to dominate our world.

During the game, you will take on the role of an alliance of two nightmarish creatures from the Cthulhu mythos. Your cards will generate Horror that will allow you to power especially formidable abilities and effects, including summoning your Avatars to the field of battle.

At the beginning of your turn you rotate the Power Cores on the Character cards and other cards in play area, dealing damage to the opponent, gaining defense and raising horror - a special resource used for powerful actions. Then you can play up to two actions, chosen from: rotating a chosen Power Core again, playing a card (ally, ability, item or maneuver), drawing a card or sometimes summoning an Avatar. At the end there is an obligatory card draw. You win if you deal enough damage to the opponent's Characters or if your opponent has to draw a card from an empty deck.

-description from publisher
boardgame.boardgamefamily: Versions & Editions: Board Game Versions of Role-Playing Games

boardgame.name: Creatures and Caverns
boardgame.description:
On the outskirts of the village of Handerley there lies the entrance to a large network of caverns running deep below the ground. And within these caverns can be found untold treasure - riches jealously guarded by all manner of fearsome creatures. Many a brave, or foolish, soul has ventured into the darkness to seek their fortune. But very few have returned to tell their tale.

Creatures and Caverns is a solo game consisting of just 18 cards and is played completely in-hand.

The aim of the game is to journey through 3 levels of pathways and caverns, overcoming creatures and other obstacles to gain treasure and useful items... and to make it out alive!

The game was developed as an entry in the 2022 In-Hand Game Design Contest.

-description from designer

boardgame.name: Cthulhu Confidential Problem and Edge Cards
boardgame.description:
Fill your hardboiled detective’s hand with luck and doom!

As Cthulhu Confidential investigators navigate the intertwined worlds of crime and cosmic horror, they accumulate Problem cards marking the hits they take along the way.

Fortunately they also pick up Edge cards, which they can parlay into useful advantages against gangsters, gamblers and ghouls.

This accessory for in-person GUMSHOE One-2-One play contains 68 Edges and Problem cards you’re most likely to hand to your player.

You screamed for their physical manifestation, and now they’re here. Wear a wicked grin as you slide them toward your player’s trembling digits!

- from the publisher's blurb

boardgame.name: Das Beste würfeln
boardgame.description:
An educational game for coffee-traders produced for the biggest coffee trader in Germany "Tchibo".
Try to get the biggest income -
answer questions -
includes 6 beautiful designed car-minis.

boardgame.name: Golden Annual Number 3: Great War at Sea – South Seas Mandate
boardgame.description:
Great War at Sea: South Seas Mandate is based on what US Navy planners foresaw as the opening stages of War Plan Orange, the plan for a Pacific naval war against Japan. It is set in the years just after the First World War and features ships planned but never built: the American Design 150 battle cruiser, the Japanese Type X light battlecruiser, the original design for Japan’s Furutaka-class light cruiser and more.

Great War at Sea: South Seas Mandate includes 50 die-cut and silky-smooth playing pieces, thirty double-sized “long” ship pieces and 20 standard-sized square ones. There’s a 22x17-inch map (on heavy rigid stock), and a booklet with ten scenarios and the background story of the campaign.

-description from publisher's website
boardgame.boardgamefamily: Series: Great War at Sea (Avalanche Press)

result.value: Some necessary text - easily memorized or small crib sheet
Moderate in-game text - needs crib sheet or paste ups
Extensive use of text - massive conversion needed to be playable

boardgame.name: Tinderblox Sunset
boardgame.description:
Tinderblox Sunset puts players in a campfire setting in which each player attempts to keep the fire burning — but if you place the blocks badly, you risk burning down the camp!

Each turn, players draw a card from the campfire deck. The card instructs them to place on the campfire a log, a fire block, or any combination of the two (or more) in various orientations. Players use tweezers to "play with fire", and if you drop anything, you're considered a fire hazard and removed from the game. The player who is the most careful with fire wins!

Tinderblox Sunset differs from Tinderblox thanks to a marshmallow mini-expansion that lets you roast marshmallows over the fire. If a marshmallow touches fire, however, you're out!

boardgame.name: Alphabet Mix
boardgame.description:
Alphabet Mix is a word game for English- or French-speaking children. It has 78 letter cards and 2 wild cards, the cards being more like cardboard tiles, 2" x 2". It is a variant of the traditional game Memory.

The 80 cards are laid out in a 8x10 grid face down. The first player states a word of 3+ letters. Then each player in turn reveals two cards, and if either of both of them spell the next letters of the stated word, they add them to the word and score their point values; otherwise they replace unused tiles face down. The word must be spelled in order. The player who finishes the current word states another word, and play continues spelling the new word. Once 5 words have been spelled, all the cards are reshuffled and re-dealt.

The player who achieves an agreed-on total -- 50 is recommended for beginners -- wins the game.

boardgame.name: Eight Ball Deluxe Pinball
boardgame.description:
The Amtex Collector's series captures the experience of actual pinball games made by the world's leading pinball manufacturers.

Eight Ball DeluxeTM, famous for its mastery of design and classic pool table theme, was one of Bally's greatest pingames. Now, play it on your PC in Full Screen, Real-Time Animation!

- from the back of the box

boardgame.name: Helsinki
boardgame.description:
The famous Senate Square in the center of the Finnish capital is surrounded by government buildings, the
university, the cathedral and the Sederholm House. The players ́ task is to design pavilions across the square to protect pedestrians in the rain. Helsinki is based on the design of Copenhagen by the same design team, but with some added complexity.

The center board depicts the Senate Square with 8 spaces (two per side) and 8 cards, with each card connected to two spaces. The player on their turn advances their pawn 1-3 spaces, then must choose to take cards or build a pavilion. Each space is connected to two face up cards, and the player may choose to draw these into their hand (making sure to respect the 7 card hand limit, a key challenge in the game). The cards are in one of 5 colors and show a shape of size 2 to 5. To build a pavilion, the player plays a card showing the piece they want to play, and then must play an additional number of cards of the same color to match the size of the piece. Finally, the piece must be "slid" onto their game board (which also represents the Senate Square) from the side of the Square their pawn is on on the main board. Covering certain spaces earns a coat of arms, which may be spent to use one of the 15 one-time special actions.

Players score points for completing rows and columns, and the player with the most points at the end of the game is the winner.

-description from publisher

boardgame.name: Wordy Birdy
boardgame.description:
Wordy Birdy is a turn-based card game version of "word find" puzzles. Its deck has 66 letter cards and 3 "Wordy Birdy" wild cards that stand for any letter. Letters have a point value; wild cards have 0 points. One copy of each vowel is a "Double word score" card.

Each player is dealt 5 cards, then 40 more cards are dealt into an 8x5 array, face up. Each player in their turn makes a word out of letters in the grid with one card from the hand. The letters in the grid must make a chain of adjacent cards that doesn't overlap itself; the card from the hand can be inserted anywhere in the word, including the first letter. The player keeps those letters and their score, and the dealer fills the holes in the array from the deck, until it is used up. A player may pass if they can see no play.

The games ends after each player has made 5 words, or each player passes in turn. The highest total score wins.

boardgame.name: Touched On: Hurstbridge Booster
boardgame.description:
A booster train line for Touched On, allowing 1 extra player to join for a fashionable festive season…

-description from the publisher's website

boardgame.name: Jewels of Puerto Primo
boardgame.description: A set collection game for 2-4 players. Players are pirates out to sell the most valuable jewelry to the self-crowned king of the Caribbean over the course of one year. Players assemble cards representing jewelry of seven different types with seven different gems. There are an assortment of bonuses to be earned when the jewelry is sold. The princess will pay for the number of pieces in the set (1 Real for 1 piece up to 21 Reals for 6 pieces). The queen will pay a bonus for three different types of either setting and/or gem that change each month. And the king pays for sets at the end of the year; his demands are revealed one-at-a-time at the beginning of each month. After a year of selling jewels to the family, if you can sail away with the most doubloons you win.

boardgame.name: Lords of Eternity
boardgame.description:
Long ago, for reasons that have never been clear, one hundred brave souls were selected by the Power to have a great destiny. Those chosen felt the Power pour into them, changing them. They were granted Abilities beyond that of mere mortals, the chance to harness the Power, to shape it to their own ends. Some yet appear human. Others have been twisted, formed, shaped by the Power. They've grown in physical strength, in intellect, in mechanical aptitude, and in magic.

These hundred, these chosen few, these immortals have but one destiny. They walk among the mortals, struggling to reach the end time, the time of the final battle.

When they battle, the victor seizes the Power from the vanquished and grows stronger. Now, after much time has passed, the remaining few are unequaled in all of history, mightier than any who have come before. The numbers dwindle, leading to the final confrontation.

The survivors have banded into factions, sworn to defend each other. All know that one day, those promises will fail and they will fight to the last. That one will claim the Prize: total power and understanding over all living things.

They are the Lords of Eternity.

boardgame.name: Exploding Words
boardgame.description:
The Exploding Words deck has 69 letter cards and 1 rules card. Each vowel has 3 normal cards, 1 double word score card, and 1 Kaboom card.

Each player is dealt a 7-card hand, and then over 5 rounds, players draw a card then discard a card, trying to have the best words to play. After 5 rounds players in turn lay down the word(s) from their hand.

Kaboom cards cannot be discarded, and they blow up any word they are in, giving it no score. A Kaboom card can be played in one of your words, blowing it up but leaving the other words okay, or you can keep it in hand and play it on top of an identical letter in a word someone else plays after you. If you don't play a Kaboom in any word, yours or someone else's, your whole hand explodes and you get 0 points that hand. 7-letter words are immune to explosion.

After all words are revealed and exploded, players score for their remaining words and another hand is played. The first player who gets a total score of 100 or more wins the game.

boardgame.name: Tongues Out!
boardgame.description:
The pugs ate all the lollipops! Luckily their tongues are dyed the color of the lollipop they had! Each turn, try to match two lollipops on the dice with two squishy pugs that you think licked them! When you gently squeeze the little pups, their tongue comes out! No matter how cute these chubby pugs are, they will not get away with this... The first player to match 6 pugs with lollipops’ colors wins the game!

—description from the publisher's website

boardgame.name: Crokinole Imperium
boardgame.description:
Crokinole Imperium brings three brand new experiences to the classic game of crokinole, by introducing new cards and rules that are combined with rich Medieval-Latin lore.

SUB ROSA meaning, “Under the Rose” is a Latin phrase that has been used in the middle ages to denote secrecy or confidentiality. In this game each player will earn points by completing their unique objective card and by outscoring their opponents.

FREE LANCES refers to mercenaries whose lance was free of any lord’s service. Each mercenary will offer you a single use ability that could tip the round in your favor, but be careful not to let their valuable skills go to waste.

TERRA NOVA meaning, "New Land" brings about a new land card each round that applies to all players requiring you to significantly alter your strategy. Learn the terrain and use it to your advantage or fail to adapt see an abrupt end to your thoughts of victory.

—description from the designer

boardgame.name: The Secret of John Nebthos
boardgame.description:
Secret of John Nebthos A Card Game of Adventure and Fame!

John Nebthos, the world's most eclectic explorer, has mysteriously sent a letter to exploring guilds around the world; an invitation to McGuffin Mountain to rediscover the lost treasures of history locked away in Nebthos' hidden mountain vault. Race against other guild members in the pursuit of fame and treasure as you travel from the four corners of the earth to McGuffin Mountain. Make new discoveries, thwart your opponents, and enjoy some good espresso along your journey, until you breach the mountain to uncover the treasures within...and of course before the mountain inevitably explodes.

A fun ice breaker card game for 2-4 players Ages 12+ 30 Minutes Playtime

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Conspiracy
boardgame.description:
Conspiracy is an upcoming game released in the second half of 2022, on Kickstarter. It is a fun, fast-paced tableau-builder for those who love to hear the craziest conspiracies.

There are three types of action in the game: card drawing, playing a card, and flipping a card.

A player wins and the game ends when any player reaches the given number of followers and is able to keep them until the end of the turn.

The core mechanics of the game are: drawing a card, playing a card, flipping a card, bid, tableau building, different abilities.

The game offers three modes; solo, cooperative and competitive.

boardgame.name: My Words Are Better Than Yours
boardgame.description:
This game is a card-based adaptation of Scrabble game-play. The deck has 69 letter cards, a majority of which are basic cards and just have a letter score. For each vowel, there are 3 basic cards, and one each of x2, x3, and x4 letter score cards, which multiply adjacent consonants in their word by that amount. There are also 15 consonant cards that multiply the score for the entire word by x2, x3, or x4.

Each player is dealt an 8-card hand. On their turn, a player plays a word from their hand that must use one basic card from the previous player's word if there is one; they tally the word's score and then draw to fill their hand back to 8 cards. A player may also just pass and draw one card.

The game ends after the deck runs out and all players pass in turn. The highest total score wins the game.

boardgame.name: Return to Life
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Marcus Ilerion was once a great mage, before the death of his wife. Now, he has turned to necromancy to bring her back, and he must be stopped...

Recommended Average Party Level (APL): 5
Experience from Completion: ~9,700 XP
General Theme: Dungeon Crawl
Setting: Any, Starlight Chronicles
Sessions to Finish: x1 session - x4 hours

boardgame.name: Chachapoya: SNAKE Adventurer Promo Cards II
boardgame.description:
The base Chachapoya game is expanded by 2 new different adventurer cards. We shuffle the SNAKE Adventurer promo cards into the adventurer's deck, then prepare the other cards as its written in the game rules.

THE BLUFF: The player leads The BLUFF card and immadiately collects all the played money that the players have already bet.

THE PARASITE: The player leads The Parasite card and chooses one player who has to discard one of the played adventurer cards. The attacked player takes all of their cards back and bets again.

Enjoy playing the game and have fun with treasure hunting!

boardgame.name: Orrorsh
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

THE DELPHI COUNCIL NEEDS YOU!

Delphi Missions: Orrorsh is a set of adventures to enhance any ongoing Torg Eternity campaign.

Ten missions inside are suitable for an evening of play, plus one that can be mixed with any of the others for added flavor. Each adventure may be dropped into an existing story, or played on its own. Horrors, Nightmares, and dark rituals await!

This product contains adventures suitable for Alpha and Beta Clearance Storm Knights written by Torg heavy hitters Bill Slavicsek, Steve Kenson, Shane Lacy Hensley, John Terra, John Watson, and others.

INSIDE YOU‘LL FIND:

• Eleven different adventures, all set within different parts of Orrorsh.
• Great for a one night fill-in, or to extend an act that ends too early.
• New foes to battle and new challenges to face!

boardgame.name: Ōkyū No Kazari Eshi
王宮の飾り絵師 (Painter in the Royal Palace)
boardgame.description:
In 王宮の飾り絵師 (Ōkyū No Kazari Eshi), roughly translated as Royal Palace Decorative Painter, the players are each painters who have been hired by the royal family to paint the Monochrome Palace.

Each player receives a die showing different colors and one showing different numbers. The players also get a sheet which shows the outline of a painting which they will be coloring in during the game.

On a turn, the players simultaneously choose the faces for their dice and then reveal. Beginning with players who chose the smaller number, players can color in sections on their sheet corresponding to the number and color chosen as their dice values. However, as the resolution proceeds to higher valued die, you will not be able to fill in colors that were chosen by players with lower numbers, and other similar concerns.

The game includes royal request cards that can grant points at the end of the game (e.g. have the most sectors of a certain color) or during the game (e.g. be the first do have one section of each color).

The game ends after 12 rounds, and the player with the most points wins.
boardgame.boardgamedesigner: Kosuke Zaitsu (ザイツ コウスケ)

boardgame.name: Countin' Sheep Card Game Combo
boardgame.description:
This is a pair of children's card games to celebrate and advertise the release of Cadaco's Countin' Sheep line of plushy sheep dolls. The games are:

Sheep Sweep

A version of Crazy 8s. In turn each player plays a card that matches the previous card in either color or name of the plushy doll on the card. If no play is possible, they draw a card and play it if possible. Lucky cards can change the color; Sleep cards make the player to your right skip their next turn. The first player to play all their cards wins.

Go Graze

A version of Go Fish. There are four cards for each of 13 ranks. In their turn a player asks another player for cards of a certain rank; if they have any they must give them all, otherwise they say "Go graze" and the asker draws a card, showing and counting it if it's the requested rank. A successful play lets the player play again. A complete set of 4 of a rank are placed on the table. After all the cards are placed in sets, the player with the most sets wins.

boardgame.name: Starship Captains
boardgame.description:
Welcome aboard and congrats on the promotion! Your "new" starship is ready to embark on its first big voyage. Just scrape off some of the rust, and she'll do fine. And that crew? Might look a little green around the edges, but they're your crew now. Make us proud.

The stars are calling...and adventure awaits!

As newly promoted Starship Captains, players are in command of their first starship and hungry to prove themselves in a galaxy full of space pirates, grumpy old androids, ancient artifacts, and interplanetary adventures.

In this 2-4 player Eurostyle game, which mixes action selection and engine building, you'll manage a diverse crew of cadets, ensigns, androids, and officers — each with different special roles and capabilities. By earning medals, you can promote and train your crew for even greater effectiveness. Similarly, you can upgrade your ship with powerful engine building technology for maximum synergy.

What will you do with this enhanced crew and ship? Explore an ever-shifting galaxy full of dangerous pirates and interplanetary missions in order to boost your reputation with three distinct galactic factions for bountiful rewards.

Do you have what it takes to deftly command your crew and become the best captain in the cosmos? We'll see!

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Crown & Crescent
boardgame.description:
Crown and Crescent models the two years of intense, fierce fighting in South Carolina during the Revolutionary War. It adopts and modifies the unique and innovative command and control mechanics created by the Ragnar Brothers for ANGOLA!

—description from the publisher

result.value: Some necessary text - easily memorized or small crib sheet
Moderate in-game text - needs crib sheet or paste ups
Extensive use of text - massive conversion needed to be playable

boardgame.name: A Trifling Matter
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

MYSTERY, INTRIGUE, AND HORROR SURROUND THE HELLION COURT...

Orrorsh is a terrifying, deadly cosm where victory rarely comes without a price, but one where the Storm Knights must go to uncover the secrets of the greatest of all High Lords.

In A Trifling Matter, the heroes are sent to discover what it takes to destroy a seemingly unkillable Nightmare who is one of the Gaunt Man’s most powerful servants. Their hunt will take them from the ghats of India to the jungles of Bangladesh, and from the depths of a sanitarium to the slopes of the world’s tallest mountain, all to find the dark secrets which define their quarry—and allow them to slay her forever!

INSIDE YOU’LL FIND:

• A massive Seven Act adventure that crosses the different regions of Orrorsh.

• The dark history of a complex, dangerous member of the Hellion Court.

• New foes to face and allies to help you in your fight!

boardgame.name: Interval Initiate
boardgame.description:
In Interval Initiate, players clash in 3 epic rounds of Note playing and Interval claiming! At the start of each round, each player drafts an Initiate card and draws Note cards equal to the combined health of all the Initiates on their team.
During each round, players take turns placing Note cards to either the left or right Notes stacks. Be the fastest to SLAP the correct Interval card when the Notes from the exact Interval to claim it! Beware, slapping the wrong Interval causes you to lose Notes! The player with the most intervals at the end of 3 rounds wins!

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Lord of the Chords: Who Let The Chords Out? – 2nd Booster Pack: Composers
boardgame.description: What is the best way to commemorate the greatest classical composers of all time? Pun-ify their names and crack jokes about their past of course! It's your Rachmanin-off day! Ravel in the Satie-sfaction of not needing to go Bach to work with puns that you'll never be Hayden!
boardgame.boardgameexpansion: Lord of the Chords: The Geekiest, Punniest Music Theory Card Game

boardgame.name: Lord of the Chords: Who Let The Chords Out? – 3rd Booster Pack: Modulation
boardgame.description: Crank complexity up to the maximum with the Modulation pack's new game mechanic; Cadences! Only true music theorists can harness the power of the cadence and slay the composition! Those who lack practice will be revealed! All will be enlightened!
boardgame.boardgameexpansion: Lord of the Chords: The Geekiest, Punniest Music Theory Card Game

boardgame.name: Lord of the Chords: Who Let The Chords Out? – 4th Booster Pack: Essentials
boardgame.description: The Essentials pack introduces an additional card type; the Equip! Aimed to serve every musician's favorite pastime; buying new music equipment! Equip them onto your instrument to augment your playstyle and diminish our foes!
boardgame.boardgameexpansion: Lord of the Chords: The Geekiest, Punniest Music Theory Card Game

boardgame.name: Lord of the Chords: Who Let The Chords Out? – 5th Booster Pack: Conductor
boardgame.description: This Conductor pack introduces us to a new car type; Styles! Just like how a conductor influences the way every musician in the orchestra plays the music, Style cards influences the way every player plays the game! But unlike conductors, Style cards will never get angry when you are out of tune. Never.
boardgame.boardgameexpansion: Lord of the Chords: The Geekiest, Punniest Music Theory Card Game

boardgame.name: Siege of Gallowspire
boardgame.description:
Publisher Blurb

A Pathfinder Society Scenario designed for levels 5–16, as well as Aid Characters (see below).

For a millennium, Golarion rested safe in the knowledge that history's most infamous lich, the Whispering Tyrant, was securely locked away. After a cataclysmic explosion sundered his prison, the Tyrant roams free once more. But he didn’t simply abandon his prison. Deep beneath the ground, behind nearly impenetrable magical wards, he has set in motion a necromantic ritual of extraordinary power. It's up to the Pathfinders to battle the Tyrant's guardians, break the wards, and stop the ritual that could make him unstoppable. Along the way, they’ll discover what secrets the Tyrant wanted to protect and keep from falling into his enemies' hands.

This scenario has two difficulty levels: Soldier and Champion. "Champion" is a considerably more challenging version of the adventure.

Aid Characters: Players can bring up to three additional characters of level 5 or higher to participate in this special scenario. Aid characters generate benefits to help other tables, and they can participate in special Aid Missions during the scenario. Players do not need all of their Chronicle sheets for their Aid Characters—they only need each Aid Characters' most recently earned Chronicle sheet.

Written by Brian Duckwitz

boardgame.name: Passing the Torch, Part 2: Who Speaks for the Ten
boardgame.description:
Publisher Blurb

A Pathfinder Society Scenario designed for levels 12–18 (Subtiers 12–13, 14–15, and 17–18).

The Whispering Tyrant has arisen, and war once again looms at Absalom's doorstep. Yet with most Pathfinders far to the north neutralizing the Tyrant's secret weapon, the Grand Lodge is understaffed and vulnerable. Now that the PCs have identified the threat Grandmaster Torch poses, they are among the few capable of entering the Grand Lodge's most restricted reaches, averting disaster, and changing the face of the Pathfinder Society forever.

"Who Wears the Mask" is the second and final seeker-level adventure in the "Passing the Torch" series that concludes Season 10, and these adventures take place in parallel with the events of Pathfinder Society Special #10-98: Siege of Gallowspire. This adventure is preceded by Pathfinder Society Scenario #10-22: Passing the Torch, Part 1: Who Wears the Mask. These two scenarios are intended to be played in order.

Written by Paizo Staff.

boardgame.name: Grapple
boardgame.description:
Grapple is a word game where players combine word roots with prefixes and/or suffixes to make valid words.

There are three decks, for Prefixes, Roots, and Suffixes, each having 50 cards and 2 blanks. Each player is dealt 2 cards from each deck.
During their turn, a player:
- Draws a card from any deck
- Does any of the following, as many times as they can:
--- Lay down a word made from 2-3 cards in the hand
--- Add a card from the hand to a word on the table to make a new valid word which is moved to be in front of them.
--- Take a card from a word on the table, if it leaves a valid word with 2 cards, to make a new word using the stolen card.
- If the player is unable to make any plays during the turn, they discard back down to 6 cards.

The player to empty their hand first wins.

boardgame.name: Crypt of the Devil Lich (DCC)
boardgame.description:
From the Kickstarter:

The heroes are sent into the Devil Lich’s crypt to destroy her before she can return to power, as foreseen in a prophecy. However, the unknowing heroes have actually been tricked into entering her crypt to free her from her prison. If they are truly heroes, they will uncover the deception and defeat the evil Devil Lich before she can unleash her dark designs on the surface world.

Created in homage to Gygax's classic with the goal of providing an even greater challenge, Crypt of the Devil Lich became an instant legend when it was first run as a tournament dungeon crawl. After all, this is the adventure with a mummy dragon, the hall of prophets, and a castle suspended by chains above a lava sea - not to mention a legendary villain! Now, more than 15 years after its original Gen Con debut, we are updating it for the 5th edition and DCC rules sets.

Perhaps the most cherished dungeon crawl ever published by Goodman Games, Crypt of the Devil Lich has been completely updated and converted to new rules sets. It’s ready for your table: are your players ready for the devil lich?
boardgame.rpg: Dungeon Crawl Classics Role Playing Game

boardgame.name: Crypt of the Devil Lich: The Lost Level (DCC)
boardgame.description:
From the Kickstarter:

A completely new level to the complex, designed in the original tournament style of multiple designers all coordinated by a master dungeon architect.
boardgame.rpg: Dungeon Crawl Classics Role Playing Game

boardgame.name: Legend of the Five Rings: The Card Game – Extended Kyuden Bayushi/Support of the Scorpion
boardgame.description: Double sided promo full art alternate card
boardgame.boardgameaccessory: Legend of the Five Rings: The Card Game

boardgame.name: The Dungeon Alphabet: Fifth Printing
boardgame.description:
From the publisher:

This printing is a full 80 pages, including all the letter entries from the expanded previous printing, ranging from “A is for Altars” to “Z is for Zowie” – and everything in between.

This new printing also includes the first English publication of the new entry “C is for Ciphers.” Originally written in English by Michael Curtis then translated for the German edition of the book, it now appears in English for the first time!

boardgame.name: Tales of the Northlands: Wooden Resource Pack
boardgame.description:
This pack contains the following wooden resources (shaped accordingly):

24 Wheat (in yellow)
30 Fish (in blue)
38 Wood (in brown)

The pack was included with the deluxe version of the game, but also made available for those who purchased the standard game.
boardgame.boardgameaccessory: Tales of the Northlands: The Sagas of Noggin the Nog

boardgame.name: Monthly Monster Volume 1: Mimics
boardgame.description:
The Monthly Monster is a side project of mine in order to create an entire bestiary of monsters to add into your games, one entry at a time.

In the first draft of Vol. 1 you will have a first glance at mimics made [almost] completely using the tried and true rules used to create monsters for ZWEIHANDER Grim & Perilous RPG. The only thing I had to whip up is one single trait, all else is 100% kosher and by the good book Liber Malus. That is, if I read it right.

boardgame.name: Monthly Monster Volume 2: Oozes
boardgame.description:
Oozes have infested the Library in the second issue of Monthly Monster!

Inside you will find oozes of 4 different sizes and destructive capability as well as a new weapon quality and hazard type.

boardgame.name: Flantastic Ooze Spells
boardgame.description:
Melt your opponent’s armor off with corrosive bolt, trap your enemies in a fatal surprise with gelatinous wall, or conjure an oozcelot to fight at your side!

This supplement contains twelve ooze-themed spells for bards, druids, rangers, sorcerers, warlocks, and wizards.

boardgame.name: Oozes, Fungus & Puddings
boardgame.description: 25 Oozes, Jellies, Puddings, Jams, Treacles, and such...of evil and nefarious varieties. Every color of the awful and digestive rainbow, all of these oozes are accompanied by slimes, molds, and mushrooms sure to make your players shudder in dismay.

boardgame.name: Noblecrumpet's Guide to Slimes, Jellies, and Oozes
boardgame.description:
What slimy creatures await in the dark dungeon depths?
Noblecrumpet's new guide is all about oozes! Gelatinous, wriggling, stinking oozes! Although many oozes act the same, some of the new monsters within will challenge your tactics for facing these gooey goons. The guide also contains tools for creating your own ooze-themed characters and how that will affect their personality and background!

boardgame.name: Shiny's Sundry of Slimy Ooze
boardgame.description: Shiny's Sundry of Slimy Ooze is a 26-page booklet containing 10 monsters, 20 items, 2 familiars, 3 spells, the oozoid playable race and a bunch of lore related to slimy ooze compatible with the world's most popular RPG system's 5th edition. Arm yourself with Gaixelgryz's Armory, full of ooze-related weapons and armor for brave adventurers! Research in Mirvenax's Laboratory and discover the advances in the creation of ooze-life: mounts, familiars, prostethics and much more! Take a seat in Oolanthryx's Roaming Kitchen and have a surprising meal or taste one of their ooze brews! Travel alongside Oozonia, the Free City, and explore the oceans in this flying and swimming city, discovering creatures in the depths! Venture the Titanic Corpse, the omnious island filled with evil ooze-spawn!

boardgame.name: DC Deck-Building Game: Clayface Promo Card
boardgame.description:
This DC Deck-Building Game Promo Card was included with early orders of DC Deck-Building Game: Dark Nights: Metal ordered directly from Cryptozoic and some retailers.

Villain
Reveal the top 3 cards of your deck, then discard all cards with the highest cost revealed this way. Draw the rest.
boardgame.boardgamecompilation: DC Deck Building Game: Anniversary Promo Pack
boardgame.boardgameexpansion: DC Comics Deck-Building Game: Forever Evil
DC Comics Deck-Building Game: Heroes Unite
DC Comics Deck-Building Game: Teen Titans
DC Deck-Building Game: Dark Nights – Metal

Extensive use of text - massive conversion needed to be playable

boardgame.name: Flappy Families
boardgame.description:
Flappy Families is a family-friendly card game for 2 - 5 players where players collect sets of native New Zealand birds while trying to avoid the Predators!

Players will have to engage their memory to try and match birds of the same families. As well as flipping cards face up on the board players will be putting their own cards face down onto the board. They will be able to use this information to try and make future matches - unless another player foils their plan!

At the end of the game the player with the best collection of birds, judged by having large families and by collecting birds from the special bonus point families, will be crowned the winner.

The game features 51 unique illustrations of native New Zealand birds, as well as the fearsome predator: the Stoat. The beautiful illustrations have been made by the talented Auckland-based Sam Kim.

—description from the designer

boardgame.name: Lock 'n Load Tactical: Enemy At The Gates
boardgame.description:
Enemy at the Gates is an expansion for the Heroes of the Bitter Harvest for the Lock 'n Load Tactical series. It features a fluid, impulse-based turns, squad-level, and individual heroics, plus lots of armor and special rules to bring the fight for the city of Stalingrad. From the first drive to cut off the city along the north bank of the Volga to the brutal and close-in street to street and room to room fighting that raged across the city. Fighting in the Dzerzhinsky Tractor Works Factory and on the slopes of Mamayev Kurgan. Fighting in the Red October Factory complex and at Pavlovs House as well as the German attempt to capture the main ferry landings are covered. New equipment is introduced to both sides as the Maxim Machinegun and the ROKS-3 flamethrower are added to the Soviet arsenal. The Germans receive shipments of MG42 Machineguns and the StuH 42 join the battle.
New Module Specific rules are introduced such as Severe Rubble terrain, Snipers are allowed to reposition to take advantage of the unique Sniper engagements that were so common in Stalingrad. Sewer movement is also introduced as it was such a pervasive means of getting around the bombed-out city.

4 new maps and 1 sheet of counters are included in this expansion

—description from the publisher
boardgame.boardgameexpansion: Lock 'n Load Tactical: Heroes of the Bitter Harvest

boardgame.name: Umbrella Sky
boardgame.description:
Umbrella Sky is a tile-laying, city beautifying game with colorful umbrellas, banners, and light bulbs!

In Umbrella Sky, players compete with each other to decorate their street and get the attention of tourists by hanging beautiful umbrellas, colorful banners, and bright light bulbs! The more attractive the street, the higher the score!

A public art project inspires this game with the same title exhibited in cities worldwide to add color to the gray spaces around us.

- Finalist to The Cardboard Edison Award Design Contest 2022
- Finalist to The ION Awards Design Contest 2022
- Finalist to The Board Game Workshop Design Contest 2021

—description from the designer

boardgame.name: Mini Rogue: Coaster Expansion
boardgame.description:
Mini Rogue Coaster Expansion is a small expansion with additional quests. At the start of the game you roll a die to determine which quest has been assigned to you (for example "Kill 10 Monsters"). Upon the completion of the quest you gain 4 XP.

This Expansion was initially a Kickstarter Exclusive.

boardgame.name: Warzone Eternal
boardgame.description:
Warzone Eternal is a fast-playing skirmish miniatures game in which players collect a force representing one of humanity’s five powerful megacorporations—Bauhaus, Capitol, Cybertronic, Imperial, and Mishima—or the hordes of necrobionic warriors of Algeroth, the Dark Legion Apostle of War. Through scenario-driven battles, players will engage in the constant covert, or not so covert, fight for supremacy amongst the megacorporations or the never-ending battle against the darkness to preserve humanity—or destroy it.

Warzone, the classic tabletop miniatures game of skirmishes in the techno-fantasy universe of Mutant Chronicles, returns with Warzone Eternal! A massively popular miniatures game in the 1990s, Warzone captured the imagination of players with its adrenaline-fueled imagery and its quick and engaging ruleset. Res Nova seeks to recapture that spirit with Warzone Eternal and has assembled a crack team to do so.

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Warhammer 40,000: Chaos Gate - Daemonhunters
boardgame.description:
Lead humanity’s greatest weapon, the Grey Knights, in this fast-paced turn-based tactical RPG. Root out and purge a galaxy-spanning plague in a cinematic, story-driven campaign, using the tactics and talents of your own personalised squad of Daemonhunters.

Source: The Game Website.

boardgame.name: Pathfinder Flip-Tiles: Campsites
boardgame.description:
24 double-sided 6x6" map tiles to to create campsite maps quickly, including caves, deserts, dungeons, forest clearings, hilltops, lodges, swampy isles, tundra, and urban areas.

Wet, dry, and permanent markers erasable.
